prompt: Give me some suggestions for incorporating high-protein vegan options in my diet.
messages:
[{'content': 'Give me some suggestions for incorporating high-protein vegan options in my diet.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Start with a protein-rich breakfast. This will help you feel full and satisfied throughout the day so you don't have any cravings.
-Oatmeal with peanut butter
-Smoothie with fruit and protein powder. 
For lunch and dinner, you can add some beans or lentils. Beans and lentils are a great source of protein and fiber. They can be added to soups, salads, burritos and more. 
Choose plant-based protein sources if you go out to eat. There are many available options at most restaurants these days. Some options include:
-Veggie burgers
-Tofu stir-fries
-Falafel wraps
For snacking, be sure to include nuts, seeds, and trail mix. These are a great way to give yourself a quick boost of protein. They can be eaten independently, or you can even add them to smoothies, oatmeal, or baked goods. 

Here are some additional tips for your diet:
-Read food labels: Check the nutrition labels to see how much protein is in your food. 
-Cook at home rather than dining out. You'll have more control over what ingredients you're using this way. This makes it easier to add protein to your meal. 
-Get creative: There are endless possibilities to vegan cooking. Experiment and find flavors you enjoy. 

Here is a quick list of some high-protein vegan foods that you can add to your diet:
-Quinoa
-Hemp seeds
-Chia seeds
-Nutritional yeast
-Broccoli
-Lentils

 ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Write a Twitter thread about what to include in a review of your personal finances.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a Twitter thread about what to include in a review of your personal finances.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Tweet 1:
Your personal finances are important. 

Strong finances can give you confidence in your present and future life. A personal financial review is one way to make sure everything is in check. 

See this thread for a breakdown of how to keep your finances in check. (Pardon the pun)

Tweet 2:
Start with your debt and assets. 

Write down all your assets, their value, and the expected appreciation/depreciation rate. Your assets include your house, car, accounts, and valuable collectibles. Now calculate your debts and be sure to include the value and rate of interest. 

Once done, you can calculate your net worth by taking your debts from your assets. 

Tweet 3:
Assess your debts. 

In step one, we wrote down our debts and interest rates. Look at this data and determine if it is needed to accelerate paying it off. Paying off debt can save you heaps of money in interest over the long term. Something as simple as paying your mortgage off Bi-Weekly instead of monthly can save you thousands in interest. 

The snowball or avalanche methods may be an excellent place to start. 

Tweet 4:
Calculate your income. 

What money is available to you every month? Factor in every single source of income you have, whether that's your 9-5, your side hustle, or any benefits you may receive. This is the money you have to work with, and it is crucial you try to keep expenses below this number to grow wealth. 

Income can come from a variety of sources. Some people make good money from their side hustle selling eggs. 

Tweet 5:
Spend analysis. 

It's a long, tedious process, but categorizing and analyzing your spending is invaluable when improving your finances. By taking your bank statements and categorizing your transactions, you can get a real insight into where your money goes each month. 

You will likely be shocked by what you find. 

Tweet 6: 
Build that budget.

So you have your income and know what you spend your money on. Great. This exercise should be easy if you spend less than you make each month. If not, then prepare to make some sacrifices. Every unique category from your spending analysis now forms your budget categories. Populate these categories with figures making sure to account for your savings goals and debt payments. 

DO NOT EXCEED YOUR BUDGET. 

", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I‚Äôm a writer and my work schedule is kind of unpredictable‚Äîsome weeks I‚Äôm stretched thin but others I‚Äôm twiddling my thumbs. What are some ways I can earn additional income without being tied to a specific schedule or having to meet a minimum number of work hours per week? Give me at least 2 suggestions that are related to writing/editing.
messages:
[{'content': 'I‚Äôm a writer and my work schedule is kind of unpredictable‚Äîsome weeks I‚Äôm stretched thin but others I‚Äôm twiddling my thumbs. What are some ways I can earn additional income without being tied to a specific schedule or having to meet a minimum number of work hours per week? Give me at least 2 suggestions that are related to writing/editing.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "No problem; here are some ways to earn additional income where you can set your own schedule and work minimal hours: 

-Drive for a ride-share service - If you have a car in decent shape and a good driving record, you can sign up to drive for Uber or Lyft. With these platforms, you can set your own schedule.
-Sign up with a delivery service - Many delivery services like Instacart will allow delivery drivers to set their own schedules. 
-Take surveys online - There are many different platforms that pay users low rates to take surveys online, such as MTurk, Prolific, Springboard Panel, and Ipsos. The pay rate is usually relatively low, but you'll have a lot of freedom to set your own schedule and decide which surveys are (or aren't) worth your time.
-Sign up for pet-sitting services - Platforms like Rover.com allow you to market yourself as a dog walker or pet sitter. You can visit other people's homes to check on their pets or host their pets at your home for a single day or multiple overnight stays. You'll have the power to decline any offer that doesn't suit your schedule. 
-Sign up for focus groups - With focus groups, you can get paid just to share your opinion on products or entertainment. These groups often require you to be present in person or virtually for specific hours, but you can always decline if the scheduled time doesn't work for you. The same is true of signing up for mock juries. 
-Become a mystery shopper - There are several different services that will pay you to visit stores and businesses as an undercover quality control analyst. Typically, they'll provide you with a checklist of things to review in the store and very clear instructions. All you have to do is visit the spot in question on your own time, follow the directions, and get paid. If the directions require you to make a purchase, the company will reimburse you. 
-Sell arts and crafts - If you've got a hobby (or more than one) that produces marketable products, consider selling them on platforms like Etsy, eBay, or Shopify. If your schedule is unpredictable, consider setting a shop policy that informs buyers that you're only available to ship items and respond to customer inquiries on certain days/times each week. You can also sell these items on your own website or at craft vendor fairs. 
-Re-sell used items - There are plenty of websites and brick-and-mortar stores where you can sell your used clothes, electronics, furniture, appliances, and more. 
-Sign up for a copywriting platform - You may want to do some research on these platforms to determine which is the best fit, as some do require their writers to meet a monthly minimum of work hours. Some don't, though, and will simply list available short-term copywriting projects for you to take or leave as you see fit.
-Start your own small business - You can work with clients as a writing coach, editor, or in any other capacity you feel qualified to. It will be up to you to determine when you meet with clients and for how long. You can also set your own pay rate.
", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I'm planning a roller skating party for a group of middle schoolers. Most of them have roller skating experience through their physical education classes. What are some group games that we could play on the rink that will hold their attention and break up the long skating session?
messages:
[{'content': "I'm planning a roller skating party for a group of middle schoolers. Most of them have roller skating experience through their physical education classes. What are some group games that we could play on the rink that will hold their attention and break up the long skating session?", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Here are some group roller skating games that can be used for a group of intermediate-level skaters in the middle school age group:

* The Four Corner Game: The Four Corner game doesn't require any skating experience and is mostly a matter of luck. When the music plays, the skaters travel around the rink like normal. When the music stops, they find a corner. A designated dice roller will roll the large fuzzy die, and whichever corner number is rolled is removed from the game. This process of elimination continues until only one player is left and they are declared the winner. There are variations that can be used, such as playing odd/even corners or keeping the number that is rolled rather than eliminating that corner, which speeds up the game significantly.

* Rockin' Robin (or the Record Game): This game is for skaters of intermediate skill. The DJ will play the songs "Rockin' Robin" or "You Spin Me Round" and blow the whistle throughout the song. When the whistle blows, skaters must turn and skate in the opposite direction. The whistle strikes may be fast and challenging, resulting in skaters making a complete circle. Skaters must pay close attention to the whistles.

* Shoot the Duck: This game is played in teams, either red vs. blue or girls vs. boys. When the DJ blows the whistle, students must assume a squatting position on their skates and cannot use their legs to gain speed. As skaters lose momentum, they will stop moving and sit on their bottom. The goal is to be the last skater moving in order to earn a point for their team. The first team to five points wins the opportunity to skate one song all by themselves.

* Dodgeball: For advanced skaters, adults/teachers/employees can throw the balls while students skate around the rink and "dodge" the balls. If a skater is "hit," they must sit in the middle of the floor. The goal is to be the last skater standing. If a skater catches the ball, the adult must sit down, instead. Adults should begin by throwing the balls high, so they can be easily ducked under, but aim progressively lower as the song continues. 

These games are competitive or involve silly movements that are sure to keep skaters engaged. Longer games such as dodgeball can be played during large skating blocks, while it's easier to fit Rockin' Robin and short rounds of The Four Corner Game in between other activities. ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Tell me a bit about Tudor women's fashion. Give me at least a paragraph on three different style changes. Make sure one of the paragraphs is about innovations in undergarments.
messages:
[{'content': "Tell me a bit about Tudor women's fashion. Give me at least a paragraph on three different style changes. Make sure one of the paragraphs is about innovations in undergarments.", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'At the Tudor court, small, flat-fronted waists leading to full breasts pressed down by the square-necked gown were all the rage. How was that achieved? In short, it was the use of busks that produced the silhouette and structure of the upper part of gowns. A busk could be made out of wood, bone, or sometimes metal. During the Tudor period, these flat inserts became more and more ornamental. They could be etched with personal messages or swirls of branching flora. These busks were the first step toward the corset we would later become so familiar with, providing rigidity and forcing good posture that advertised to the world that a woman was high-born. 

One very important piece of underwear was the "bum roll." Showing up for the first time in the 1500s, this stuffed tube of fabric was tied around the lower portion of a lady's waist to increase her hip circumference and the amount of fabric she could wear on her skirts. Since silks and brocades were the going materials of the day and deeply exclusive because of cost, the more fabric worn translated into more wealth a wearer was likely to have. These bum rolls allowed for wide swathes of skirts, more pleats, and flounces. These undergarments also helped the women to bear some of the weight of their heavy skirts without it sitting directly on their hip bones. Tudor fashion was more about statement than comfort. Like busks, bum rolls were essentially shapewear, modifying the female silhouette to what was considered ideal at the time. 

One of the most important pieces of jewelry a woman of this period may have owned would have been her girdle belt. This was a long string, often of silver or gold and embellished with gems, that highlighted a woman's small waist and hung downward. Some women wore a pomander ball at the end of their girdle belts for when the city air got especially ripe. Others, like Anne Boleyn, used it to carry small prayer books about with them. Katherine of Aragon was even known to clutch the girdle belt of her patron saint while in childbirth, though this doesn't seem to have provided her with any luck. There are portraits of Kaherine herself in an immense string of pearls girdle belt that matches her royal necklaces. One of Jane Seymour, Henry's third wife, shows a girdle belt with a pattern of pearls and red gems that leads to a very large oval stone set in gold at the end. ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Turn this list into a paragraph or two.

1. It's all about keeping pets cool. Never leave them in a hot car even just for a short time. Temperatures can rise really quickly in there.
2. Try to keep pets out of the sun completely. If you need to take your dog out for exercise head out early in the day before it gets hot or leave it late as possible towards evening. Watch out for how warm the pavement is. If it's too hot for your hand, then it's too hot for their paws.
3. If you have to take your pet outside for a short period of time use pet-safe lotion on exposed parts of your pet's skin, especially the tips of their ears and nose. Keep pets in the shade wherever possible.
4. Make sure your pet has access to both shade and fresh drinking water. Put ice cubes in their water bowl or maybe make some frozen pet-friendly treats. Top up their water at a public tap when out and about and take plenty of fresh water out with you.
5. When its hot you might need to restrict the amount of activity they do or when they do it. For example avoid walking dogs in the middle of the day when it is usually hottest.
6. Keep an eye on where your pets are, especially cats, so they don't end up locked in a hot greenhouse or shed. Also, make sure you know where they are or put up screens if you have windows or balcony doors open.
7. For pets like fish, lizards, and birds tanks and cages should be kept away from direct sunlight, and any water changed regularly to stop them from overheating.
8. If you don't have any pets you can still look after animals in the heat. You can help wildlife in your garden by putting out fresh clean water for drinking and in case they want to take a dip!

1. It's all about keeping pets cool. Never leave them in a hot car even just for a short time. Temperatures can rise really quickly in there.
2. Try to keep pets out of the sun completely. If you need to take your dog out for exercise head out early in the day before it gets hot or leave it late as possible towards evening. Watch out for how warm the pavement is. If it's too hot for your hand, then it's too hot for their paws.
3. If you have to take your pet outside for a short period of time use pet-safe lotion on exposed parts of your pet's skin, especially the tips of their ears and nose. Keep pets in the shade wherever possible.
4. Make sure your pet has access to both shade and fresh drinking water. Put ice cubes in their water bowl or maybe make some frozen pet-friendly treats. Top up their water at a public tap when out and about and take plenty of fresh water out with you.
5. When its hot you might need to restrict the amount of activity they do or when they do it. For example avoid walking dogs in the middle of the day when it is usually hottest.
6. Keep an eye on where your pets are, especially cats, so they don't end up locked in a hot greenhouse or shed. Also, make sure you know where they are or put up screens if you have windows or balcony doors open.
7. For pets like fish, lizards, and birds tanks and cages should be kept away from direct sunlight, and any water changed regularly to stop them from overheating.
8. If you don't have any pets you can still look after animals in the heat. You can help wildlife in your garden by putting out fresh clean water for drinking and in case they want to take a dip!", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "When the weather gets hot, it's important to keep your pets cool. Keeping them out of the sun entirely is best practice, which means walking dogs early in the morning or late in the evening when temperatures and pavements are cooler for them. When walking in hot months, check the pavement temperature with your hand because if it's too hot for you, then it's too hot for their paws. If you're unable to fully avoid the sun, there are pet-safe lotions that you should apply to any exposed skin on your pet, especially ears and noses, but try to keep them in the shade whenever possible. Access to drinking water is critical in hot temperatures so make sure a bowl or two is always accessible and be sure to bring a spare bottle with you if going out. You can add ice cubes to water bowls or even prepare some frozen pet-friendly treats.  
Keep an eye on where your pets are, especially cats, so they don't end up locked in a hot greenhouse or shed. Look into putting up screens if you have open balconies or windows to ensure you know your pets' whereabouts. If you have pets like fish, birds, or lizards that are kept in tanks or cages, remember to keep them away from any direct sunlight and change the water regularly. Even if you don't have any pets you can still look after animals in the heat. You can help wildlife in your garden by putting out fresh clean water for drinking and in case they want to take a dip!", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I want to get in shape but I need ideas for exercises that I can do for my legs, but I don't have any weights to use.  Can you give me a list and explain how to do them?
messages:
[{'content': "I want to get in shape but I need ideas for exercises that I can do for my legs, but I don't have any weights to use.  Can you give me a list and explain how to do them?", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Here are some exercises you can do to train your legs without needing weights. 

1. Squats
Squats have long been regarded as the best way to build strong legs and butt. The squat mainly works your quads, glutes, and core but will also work your hamstrings to a lesser extent.

To do a squat stand with your feet hip or shoulder width apart in a stable stance. From there, push your hips back as if you were going to sit down. While the hips are moving back, let your knees bend and move down until you feel the strain. Be sure to try and maintain vertical shins throughout the exercise. Once you are at your lowest point, you can begin to push yourself back up to a standing position. You can make this harder by adding a heavy backpack or holding something in each hand so long as the objects are equal in weight.

2. Jump Squat
Similar to the standard squat, you can use a jump squat to improve your power and increase the intensity of the exercise. A jump squat will be more beneficial when building your fast-twitch muscle fibers. 

Performing a jump squat is as easy as it sounds. Start off in a squat position and perform a standard squat. Once you are at your low point, use the power in your legs to jump up and make sure to land softly in the same position you started. Try to maintain form with this exercise. Keeping your legs controlled when jumping will also help to increase core strength. 

3. Lunge
A lunge requires immense stability as you split your hips in half. A great exercise for your glutes, quads, and hamstrings, a lunge can be done pretty much anywhere. A lunge will also help you work your hip stabilizers as you try to maintain balance. 

A lunge is done by standing in a normal position with your feet. From here, extend one leg backward until both of your knees are at a 90-degree angle. Your front knee should not go past your toes. From here, push off with your back leg to regain your original stance. Repeat this for both legs as many times as you wish.

4. Jump Lunge
Just as a jump squat increases your fast-twitch muscle fibers, so will a jump lunge. A great exercise for building power in your legs. This exercise is not easy, so be careful when trying it, and ensure you are comfortable with a standard lunge first. 

To do a Jump lunge, get into a lunge position as you would normally. From the point where your knees are bent, you can now jump up and alternate your legs in the air. This should be performed in a controlled way so that you land softly. 

5. Side Lunge
A side lunge is similar to a normal lunge but has key differences. Firstly this exercise will work your abductors, glutes, and quads. Working different leg muscles on a lateral plane rather than a linear one is a good exercise. This is important as the range of motion we experience with our legs daily is large. 

Start off in a standing position. Next, move one leg out to the side. Imagine it's just one leg in a normal squat position. Your knee should be bent but not past your toes. Your other leg should be straight. From here, simply return to standing and alternate the legs as you go. 

6. Sumo Squat
We've done normal squats, so now here is the sumo squat. The sumo squat pays particular attention to your adductors, glutes, and quads. 

Start off by standing as a sumo with your legs wider than your shoulders to where it is comfortable. Keep your toes slightly pointed away from your body. From this position, perform a squat as you would usually, and again, be sure that your knee doesn't extend past your foot and that your shin stays as vertical as it can. 




", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Write up a short newswire-style story from the imaginary "Gondor News Service" announcing the fall of Sauron and the victory of western forces at the Black Gate.  Assume that first reports are incomplete and wartime secrecy means that the writer won't have the details of Frodo and Sam's mission in Mordor.  The report may hint at the destruction of the One Ring but will get key details wrong.  You can invent details such as casualty reports and quotes.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write up a short newswire-style story from the imaginary "Gondor News Service" announcing the fall of Sauron and the victory of western forces at the Black Gate.  Assume that first reports are incomplete and wartime secrecy means that the writer won't have the details of Frodo and Sam's mission in Mordor.  The report may hint at the destruction of the One Ring but will get key details wrong.  You can invent details such as casualty reports and quotes.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'STUNNING VICTORY AT THE BLACK GATE
Halfling sabotage team may have been key to the defeat of Mordor's armies

March 25, 3019

MINAS TIRITH (GNS) After a week of chaos the Capital of Gondor reacted with shock and relief that Gondorian forces and their allies from Rohan had defeated the forces of Mordor at the black gate.  The initial word of the battle came from an Eagle messenger.  The invasion's success surprised residents of Minas Tirith, as the 6,000 to 7,000-man expeditionary force attacking the Black Gates was expected to be outnumbered by a factor of at least ten-to-one by orcs and Mordor's human allies.  Many military experts considered the attack to be futile.

Accounts of the battle remain incomplete, but casualties are heavy, with over a thousand injured and several hundred dead.  Orcs were close to overrunning Western positions before the tide of battle turned.  How the forces of Mordor were defeated remains unclear. Still, initial reports indicate that the assault on the Black Gate was made in conjunction with the actions of a small team of Halfling saboteurs who were able to infiltrate Mordor and destroy its headquarters at the tower of Barad Dur, possibly with the assistance of some ancient magical artifact.

However it was accomplished, numerous eyewitnesses report seeing the tower fall and Mt. Doom erupting.  Sauron appears to have perished as the tower collapsed, and his forces broke down in disarray almost immediately.  Some observers report that the Ringwraiths turned from the battle and headed back toward Barad Dur just as it broke down,  Trolls and other monsters scattered almost immediately, and Mordor's human allies agreed to a truce shortly afterward.

The Gondorian military refused to comment on the "Hobbit Commandos," however, one source close to royal claimant Aragorn remarked that "those little people may not look all that tough, but they do have a knack for covert ops."

The victory at the Black Gate ends two weeks of turmoil for Minas Tirith and the Kingdom of Gondor which culminated in a massive battle near the city gates and the suicide of Denethor, Steward of Gondor.  Aragorn, the former northern Ranger who has claimed kingship over Gondor appears to have survived the battle and is expected to be coronated in the next month.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Rewrite this article from the perspective of the fox.

It was a warm Saturday evening and Nick and Pauline Koupparis left a door to their three-storey house open as they watched Britain's Got Talent on television. Shortly before 10pm, a curious fox padded into their home in Victoria Park, east London, and made its way upstairs, where their nine-month-old twins Lola and Isabella were asleep. The fox attacked the girls on their arms and faces. When Pauline heard the crying, she rushed upstairs. "I went into the room and I saw some blood on Isabella's cot," she said yesterday. "I thought she'd had a nosebleed. I put on the light and I saw a fox and it wasn't even scared of me, it just looked me straight in the eye."

As the children were treated in hospital, where they were in a serious but stable condition, the shocking story spread around the globe, triggering a new panic about urban foxes. Police told local residents they should keep their doors closed in hot weather for their own safety. Neighbours spoke of how foxes creep not merely into their gardens but into their kitchens and living rooms. A fox trap was set; one fox has already been killed.
messages:
[{'content': 'Rewrite this article from the perspective of the fox.

It was a warm Saturday evening and Nick and Pauline Koupparis left a door to their three-storey house open as they watched Britain's Got Talent on television. Shortly before 10pm, a curious fox padded into their home in Victoria Park, east London, and made its way upstairs, where their nine-month-old twins Lola and Isabella were asleep. The fox attacked the girls on their arms and faces. When Pauline heard the crying, she rushed upstairs. "I went into the room and I saw some blood on Isabella's cot," she said yesterday. "I thought she'd had a nosebleed. I put on the light and I saw a fox and it wasn't even scared of me, it just looked me straight in the eye."

As the children were treated in hospital, where they were in a serious but stable condition, the shocking story spread around the globe, triggering a new panic about urban foxes. Police told local residents they should keep their doors closed in hot weather for their own safety. Neighbours spoke of how foxes creep not merely into their gardens but into their kitchens and living rooms. A fox trap was set; one fox has already been killed.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "It was a warm Saturday evening, shortly before 10 pm and I was out for my evening stroll in my neighbourhood of Victoria Park, east London. To my delight, I spied a house with an open door. I could hear the sound of the television blaring out from the lounge and as I peered through the window, I saw a couple relaxing in front of Britain's Got Talent. They seemed very preoccupied, so I decided to take a closer look and go inside.

I padded into the house, through the open door and made my way upstairs. There, I saw two babies sleeping soundly in a cot. They looked about nine months old. I was curious about these human children and decided to take a closer inspection. However, I accidentally clawed one of the babies on its arms and face, and the baby started to bleed heavily. There was blood everywhere, but I certainly didn't mean to harm the human child. I think the baby was startled by my presence and she began to make a hideous wailing noise. Before I could make my escape, I heard footsteps coming up the stairs and felt an adult human presence entering the room. Then, a glaring light lit up everything and I was so shocked, I just froze. I stared in horror at the lady who was in front of me. I looked her right in the eye and she glared back at me. 

Then, I fled back down the stairs, leaping and bounding two at a time, until I was in the garden, and I sheltered behind a thick hedge. From my vantage point, I heard a terrible commotion coming from the upstairs bedroom. A female voice shrieked and yelled. I heard the sound of a loud siren and an ambulance appeared. Two men jumped out hurriedly and raced inside, in an emergency. After a few minutes, the men reappeared, grasping a baby, followed by a sobbing woman and they all drove off in the ambulance. There had been such an uproar that many people had come out of their houses to see what was happening. A man was shouting that a vicious fox had attacked and seriously injured his baby. I thought that was an extremely unfair accusation, and untrue. I am not a vicious fox. I would never attack an innocent child. What happened was an accident. Sometimes, I forget how sharp my claws are.

However, I noticed from that time on, that all doors and windows in the neighbourhood were firmly closed. There was no opportunity to enter these homes. Moreover, humans began to behave uncharacteristically and cruelly. Sadly, a tragedy happened and one of my friends was murdered. He was caught in a trap left out by one of these humans. From that time on, it was a war between foxes and humans. ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Transform the information from this text into a conversation between a space enthusiast and a skeptical friend.

A Chinese launch company has stepped up its quest to develop reusable rockets with sea platform landing tests using a small demonstrator.

The tests ‚Äî which launch and land a jet engine-powered rocket prototype to test guidance, navigation and control systems, software and communications ‚Äî are being conducted by CAS Space, a spinoff from the state-owned Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS).

A video released by the firm shows a 6.9-foot-tall (2.1 meters), 205-pound (93 kilograms) prototype lifting off from a vessel at sea off the coast of Haiyang in eastern China's Shandong Province.

The prototype reached an altitude of around 3,280 feet (1,000 m) before touching back down on the sea platform. The test flight depicted in the video took around 10 minutes, according to CAS Space.

The company has been carrying out such tests during the first few months of 2023, according to a press statement on April 4. 

Landing the first stage of a rocket on a sea platform instead of back on terra firma closer to the launch site is expected to save a significant amount of fuel, and hence reduce the amount of payload-carrying capacity lost by a rocket in reusable configuration. 

SpaceX already employs this strategy, commonly bringing the first stages of its Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy rockets down on "drone ships" stationed at sea several hundred miles from their launch sites.

CAS Space aims to launch its own reusable orbital rockets in the future, as well as a suborbital rocket for space tourism, in a similar fashion to U.S. firm Blue Origin and its New Shepard.

A CAS Space engineer told Chinese state media outlet Global Times that the firm might hold a first test flight of a near-space scientific experiment platform as early as the end of 2023.
messages:
[{'content': 'Transform the information from this text into a conversation between a space enthusiast and a skeptical friend.

A Chinese launch company has stepped up its quest to develop reusable rockets with sea platform landing tests using a small demonstrator.

The tests ‚Äî which launch and land a jet engine-powered rocket prototype to test guidance, navigation and control systems, software and communications ‚Äî are being conducted by CAS Space, a spinoff from the state-owned Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS).

A video released by the firm shows a 6.9-foot-tall (2.1 meters), 205-pound (93 kilograms) prototype lifting off from a vessel at sea off the coast of Haiyang in eastern China's Shandong Province.

The prototype reached an altitude of around 3,280 feet (1,000 m) before touching back down on the sea platform. The test flight depicted in the video took around 10 minutes, according to CAS Space.

The company has been carrying out such tests during the first few months of 2023, according to a press statement on April 4. 

Landing the first stage of a rocket on a sea platform instead of back on terra firma closer to the launch site is expected to save a significant amount of fuel, and hence reduce the amount of payload-carrying capacity lost by a rocket in reusable configuration. 

SpaceX already employs this strategy, commonly bringing the first stages of its Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy rockets down on "drone ships" stationed at sea several hundred miles from their launch sites.

CAS Space aims to launch its own reusable orbital rockets in the future, as well as a suborbital rocket for space tourism, in a similar fashion to U.S. firm Blue Origin and its New Shepard.

A CAS Space engineer told Chinese state media outlet Global Times that the firm might hold a first test flight of a near-space scientific experiment platform as early as the end of 2023.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': '"You know, this Chinese company, CAS Space, is doing some ground-breaking work on reusable rockets," said the Space Enthusiast.

Skeptical Friend: "CAS Space? Never heard of them before.

It's a spinoff from the Chinese Academy of Sciences, says Space Enthusiast. They have been conducting testing by launching and landing a little jet-powered prototype. The purpose is to test things like communications, software, guidance, navigation, and control systems.

Skeptical Friend: "That sounds dangerous. Is it secure?

"They are being cautious, yes," said the Space Enthusiast. A video showing a test launch of a 6.9-foot-tall, 205-pound prototype from a ship off the coast of Haiyang in Shandong Province, eastern China, was made public.

"That's pretty small, but how high did it go?" asked the Skeptical Friend.

According to Space Enthusiast, the prototype rose to a height of about 3,280 feet before returning to the sea platform. The entire flight lasted for almost 10 minutes.

Skeptical Friend: "Hmm. But why are they acting in this manner at sea?

Space Enthusiast: "Well, it saves a lot of fuel to put the first stage of a rocket on a marine platform rather than back on land. The rocket's ability to carry more payload won't be reduced as much in this way. This method is already employed by SpaceX with its Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy rockets.

"So, what's the end goal for CAS Space?" asked the Skeptical Friend.

They aim to launch their reusable orbital rockets, just like SpaceX, according to Space Enthusiast. Even a suborbital rocket for space tourism is in the works, somewhat akin to what Blue Origin is creating with its New Shepard.

Skeptical Friend: "Space travel, huh? When they're prepared, perhaps I'll make travel plans.

"You might not have to wait for too long," said the Space Enthusiast. According to what I've read, a test flight for a platform for close-to-space scientific experiments is scheduled for the end of 2023.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Can you suggest a list of ways I can bond with my cat? Please note that my cat is not too active, so games that involve running around won't work.
messages:
[{'content': "Can you suggest a list of ways I can bond with my cat? Please note that my cat is not too active, so games that involve running around won't work. ", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Sure! Here are some ways you can bond with your cat that don't involve them being too active.

1. Treats: Treats are a great way to bond with your feline companion. You can use handheld Churo treats if you want your cat to come close to you, as many cats love licking those treats.
2. Toy Mice: Although some toys involve cats running around a lot, toy mice tend to be better as your cat can play with them in one spot if they choose to. Sit on the floor with your cat and toss them some toy mice, encouraging them to play. You can also get toy mice that have squeakers or catnip, both of which will further encourage your cat to get involved.
3. Petting: Petting is a great, underrated way to bond with your cat. Make sure you take note of where your cat likes to be petted. Most cats don't like being touched on their belly, but some love head scratches! You can test this out by gently petting them in different places and looking for signs that they do or don't enjoy what's going on. If they don't enjoy it, try switching to petting them in a different place.
4. Catnip: Providing catnip is a good way to bring your cat close to you. Try putting some in objects that are near you, as they'll attract your cat to come closer.
5. Give Them Space: Believe it or not, giving your cat space can be a great way to bond with a skittish cat. Some cats would prefer to come to you rather than you coming to them, especially if they're new to your household. Chill near them, but don't force them to interact, and you might notice it's not long before your cat is sliding closer and warming up to you.

Remember that all cats are different, so it's important to observe your cat's personality and learn their likes and dislikes. By doing this, you'll quickly find the best way to bond with them.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Using this text create 3 slogans that could be put on posters to promote wildlife friendly gardening. Make sure the 3 slogan each includes a different type of wildlife.

DON'T TIDY UP!
Allow nature to take its course over the colder months
Having a neat and tidy garden during autumn and winter can actually hinder our garden friends. So, for your wildlife garden ideas, keep seed heads uncut for the birds, let the creepy crawlies shelter amongst the plant stems, and allow toads to hide under the leaves. Ladybirds love to overwinter around perennial plants too, so avoid the urge to cut them back.

Another good tip is not to dig your garden soil unless you are planting, or why not try the no-dig gardening method instead? Not digging really helps earthworm and beetle larvae populations to increase.

Trying this approach for your wildlife garden ideas is less work for you, and offers more support for the environment ‚Äì a win-win in our books.

prompt: What endangered animal is only found on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada?
messages: [{'content': 'What endangered animal is only found on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada?', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'The Vancouver Island marmot is an alpine dwelling marmot that is only found in the wild on Vancouver Island, British Columbia, Canada. The Vancouver Island marmot is distinguishable by its chocolate brown fur and contrasting white patches. Through conservation and breeding efforts, the population of the Vancouver Island marmot has increased from fewer than 30 wild marmots in 2003 to close to 300 marmots by 2015.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Can you rewrite this article as if you were presenting it to an environmental council?

Plastic is all around us: in our toothbrushes, pens, cars, and even clothing! It is very useful. But plastic trash ends up in the environment and is bad for animals and humans. It can take hundreds of years to break down. Recycling this plastic can take a lot of energy and often still leaves waste. We wanted to find a better way to break plastic down and reuse it to make new plastic. 

We discovered an enzyme that ‚Äúdigests‚Äù plastic in the same way that humans can digest food.  Using this enzyme to break down used plastic means we will need much less energy to recycle plastic. Plus, we can even use the products of the process to make plastics that are just as good as new ones!
messages:
[{'content': 'Can you rewrite this article as if you were presenting it to an environmental council?

Plastic is all around us: in our toothbrushes, pens, cars, and even clothing! It is very useful. But plastic trash ends up in the environment and is bad for animals and humans. It can take hundreds of years to break down. Recycling this plastic can take a lot of energy and often still leaves waste. We wanted to find a better way to break plastic down and reuse it to make new plastic. 

We discovered an enzyme that ‚Äúdigests‚Äù plastic in the same way that humans can digest food.  Using this enzyme to break down used plastic means we will need much less energy to recycle plastic. Plus, we can even use the products of the process to make plastics that are just as good as new ones!', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Members of this esteemed Environmental Council, I thank you for your time. I am here today to address a pressing issue affecting our planet, plastic pollution. This material has become an important part of our lives, from helping contain chemicals to easy access to drinkable water. However, the current disposal methods of plastics threaten animal and human health. Decomposition takes hundreds of years, our current recycling methods use too much energy, and too often, a lot of waste is produced.
We have recently discovered an enzyme capable of "digesting" plast, similar to how humans digest food. Using this product, we can significantly reduce the energy used and use the byproducts to create equal-quality plastics.
This enzymatic approach has the promise to revolutionize the plastic industry and address the ecological challenges we face. Through this method, we can reduce plastic waste's impact on our planet and its inhabitants. With this method, we are closer to minimizing waste and creating a sustainable future. I urge the council to consider using this approach seriously to help our environment and planet by forging a greener path for future generations.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Use the article below to give me the name of each species that is in danger of becoming extinct and tell me what the article says they are poached for today. Style the extracted information like so: 

- Turtle Species: current poached use



Among the populations he is fighting to preserve are the Golden coin turtle, a species once prized for medicinal purposes and used in turtle jelly but now in demand as an exotic pet whose rarity and strange looks have made it only more valuable to poachers. Buyers see the golden stripes on their heads as a symbol of prosperity and are willing in extreme cases to pay hundreds of thousands of US dollars.

Sung says there are thought to be around 100 left in Hong Kong -- one of the world's last significant populations, he says.

Facing a similar plight is the Beale's eyed turtle, fewer than 200 of which are thought to be left in Hong Kong and an unknown -- but thought to be very small -- number in mainland China. These turtles have a pattern on the back of their head in the shape of two eyes -- possibly an evolutionary trait, some scientists suggest, meant to scare off predators. Its unique looks have made it too a prize for exotic pet keepers, who pay hundreds to 

Then there is the Big-headed turtle, another strange-looking species that has become popular with those seeking an exotic pet. It has an eagle-like beak, a crocodile-like tail and a head so big it can't fit in its shell. A few hundred are left in Hong Kong, and perhaps even fewer in its other homes of Cambodia, Myanmar, Thailand and Vietnam. It can go for up to $1,000 on the illegal market.

A suspected poacher caught on one of Professor Sung Yik-hei's surveillance cameras.
A suspected poacher caught on one of Professor Sung Yik-hei's surveillance cameras.
A booming industry
None of the three turtles mentioned so far are suitable to be kept as pets. The Big-headed turtle is particularly unsuitable, Sung says, as for them to survive they would require elaborate enclosures to mimic their natural environments.

What's more, under Hong Kong law, possession of an endangered turtle is a criminal offense punishable by up to a maximum of 10 years in jail and a HK$10 million [$1.27 million] fine, depending on the species.

Yet they remain in popular demand and represent just the tip of the iceberg of the illegal trade in turtles in the city -- which involves both endangered species and more common ones.

Another cheetah has died after relocation to India, the second in less than a month
Another cheetah

prompt:
Please cut down this text to three sentences only, keeping only the important details.

No, this isn't a crafty plan to get children to eat their veggies.

As more and more people turn to plant-based food, they are hoping to produce a more planet-friendly, home-grown alternative to importing soya beans.

Peas are high in protein, but it is hard to mask their taste when they are used as a meat substitute in large amounts in vegan dishes.

Scientists discovered a gene for pea flavour 30 years ago. The research was stopped as there was no use for it. Now it could be the basis of a new industry.

"The world has changed. People increasingly want plant-based protein in their diets rather than from animals. So flavourless peas have suddenly become flavour of the day," said Prof Claire Domoney of the John Innes Centre (JIC) in Norwich, one of the scientists working on the project.

The UK imports four million tonnes of soya a year for food and animal feed, with half a million tonnes used for vegan and vegetarian foods, according to Innovate UK, the government's innovation agency.

prompt: Write a news article about how a new study was just completed by Harvard that shows the reason so many people are gluten intolerant is not because of the gluten, but because of the pesticides used on wheat when it‚Äôs growing. Don‚Äôt bog it down with science and facts, but do talk about how dangerous pesticide food is within industrial farming. Less than 300 words.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a news article about how a new study was just completed by Harvard that shows the reason so many people are gluten intolerant is not because of the gluten, but because of the pesticides used on wheat when it‚Äôs growing. Don‚Äôt bog it down with science and facts, but do talk about how dangerous pesticide food is within industrial farming. Less than 300 words. 
', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Millions of Americans have restricted or completely cut out gluten from their diets. While some skip gluten because of a chosen diet, most people do so because their bodies have rejected gluten. But a Harvard study has recently released new and incredibly interesting information which states that millions of people who think they are allergic or intolerant to gluten actually have no problem with gluten at all! 

We‚Äôre here to tell you that if you believe your body cannot properly digest gluten, or even if your doctor diagnosed you with an allergy, it is extremely likely that you have no problem with glutenous food that contains wheat. In fact, you‚Äôre likely not allergic to wheat at all. 

The Harvard study found that it is actually the pesticides used on wheat that are causing millions of people to struggle with gluten digestion. That means that if you grew wheat in your yard without any pesticides, you would probably be able to eat anything you made with it without any issues at all! 

Now, it‚Äôs important to note that this is not the case for 100% of those Americans with gluten allergies. A select few may actually be intolerant to gluten itself; however, for millions of Americans, this could change everything. 

But in order for the masses to be able to enjoy glutenous products again, something needs to change in the way we allow industrial farmers to treat and grow wheat. 

Exactly how that will happen is still unclear. But there has certainly been a lot of talk since the study was released about exactly what these big farms are putting on our food and how it‚Äôs affecting not only what we eat but also how we feel. ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: write an outreach email to a candidate named john about a quality engineer role in the automotive manufacturing industry. Include required experience and background
messages:
[{'content': 'write an outreach email to a candidate named john about a quality engineer role in the automotive manufacturing industry. Include required experience and background', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Dear John,

I hope this email finds you well. I am reaching out about an exciting career opportunity. After reviewing your qualifications and experience, we believe you would be a great fit for a Quality Engineer role we are looking to fill.

As a Quality Engineer at our company, you will play a crucial role in ensuring that our manufacturing processes adhere to rigorous quality standards. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and address quality issues, develop quality control plans, and implement continuous improvement initiatives. Your expertise will be vital in driving our commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction.

Key responsibilities:

‚Ä¢	Conducting quality audits, inspections, and assessments to identify areas for improvement
‚Ä¢	Developing and implementing quality control plans and procedures
‚Ä¢	Analyzing data and performance metrics to identify trends and patterns
‚Ä¢	Collaborating with engineering and production teams to resolve quality issues and implement corrective actions
‚Ä¢	Conducting root cause analysis and implementing preventive measures
‚Ä¢	Participating in new product development projects and ensuring adherence to quality standards
‚Ä¢	Lead supplier quality assessments and maintain effective supplier relationships
‚Ä¢	Providing training and guidance to team members on quality-related processes and practices

Qualifications:

‚Ä¢	Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field
‚Ä¢	5+ years of experience in quality engineering within the automotive manufacturing industry
‚Ä¢	Strong knowledge of quality management systems, such as ISO 9001
‚Ä¢	Proficiency in conducting quality audits and utilizing statistical tools for data analysis.
‚Ä¢	Experience with problem-solving methodologies, such as Six Sigma or Lean
‚Ä¢	Familiarity with automotive industry standards and regulations
‚Ä¢	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

We value our employees and believe in providing a supportive and rewarding work environment that fosters both personal and professional growth. As a member of our team, you will have ample opportunities for career development, access to cutting-edge technologies, and the chance to make a significant impact in the automotive manufacturing industry.

If you are excited about the prospect of joining our team and contributing to our pursuit of manufacturing excellence, I encourage you to apply by submitting your updated resume and any relevant documentation through our online application portal. I am available to provide any assistance you may need throughout the application process. I look forward to hearing from you soon. 

Warm regards,

[Name]
[Title/Position]
[Company Name]
[Contact Information]
", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Summarize the roles mentioned below for league of legends in one sentence for each role given:

MID
The mid laner is the most popular and played role among the millions of LoL players worldwide. It is one of the lines with the most action and relevance in the game and allows incredible rotations throughout the map to ensure the team's advantage.

This new meta, which benefits mages and control mage in general, is bringing with it a lane champion like Viktor, Corki (with a hybrid build), Ahri, among others. Although this is not to say that assassin champions in the mid lane are not being played anymore.

The Mid Lane has established itself as the favorite line of hundreds of players due to its versatility and importance within the game, not surprisingly, many of the most famous players in the World Championship Tournaments are also players in the mid lane.

TOP
The top line is a long, lateral and individual lane; being therefore the most isolated line of the game. It is a perfect line for those players who love to compare their skills against another player in a constant fight for control of the lane. Normally, tanks or fighters are usually played in the top lane like Sett, Dr Mundo, Yorick, among others.

This line, in League of Legends, is the closest thing to a 1v1. This is due to its very nature, since being the farthest line on the map, you will have less support (the jungler usually plays around the Dragon of the BOT lane), so the most popular summoner is Teleport. Although the Teleport has recently received a nerf, the use of this summoner spell is left to the player's choice and in consideration of the match up.

prompt: Write a cautionary tale about a group of tourists on a self-guided tour of the African savannah. It should exemplify the implicit moral of not antagonizing or disrupting the wildlife.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a cautionary tale about a group of tourists on a self-guided tour of the African savannah. It should exemplify the implicit moral of not antagonizing or disrupting the wildlife.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Tory, Dannie, and Jett were having the time of their life on the safari. They had seen a number of antelope, baboons, and even lions. As they slowly crawled along the dirt path, they saw a large figure looming up ahead.
"It's an elephant!" Dannie cried, almost hopping up from the back seat. Jett pressed on the gas, and they accelerated towards the massive mammal. It was pretty close to the road, reaching for leaves from a nearby tree. Jett stopped nearby, and the three gawked.
"It's huge!" Tory said in amazement. 
"Honk at it." Dannie punched Jett's shoulder, her eyes never leaving the elephant. It had noticed them now and tensed, holding its ears out. It stomped its foot in agitation and trumpeted at them. Against his better judgment, Jett honked the horn to get the elephant's attention. It was enraged now and began dashing towards them at alarming speed.
"Go, go, go!" Tory clutched the back of the headrest as the car lurched forward. It couldn't find much traction on the dirt road, and the elephant began to gain on them. With a great lurch, the car lifted off its back wheels for a second under the elephant's tusks. A moment later, the car skidded onto the open road and took off.

The three had escaped with a nasty dent in their car, a somber reminder that nature should sometimes be left to its own devices.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Please rewrite this article from the perspective of the spy whale, as if it was reporting to its Russian handler. 

People should ‚Äúavoid contact‚Äù with a famous beluga whale to avoid accidentally injuring or killing it, the Norwegian Directorate of Fisheries has said.

The whale, nicknamed Hvaldimir, shot to international fame in 2019 after it was spotted wearing a specially made harness with mounts for a camera, leading experts to believe the whale may have been trained by the Russian military.

Since 2019, it has ‚Äúbeen traveling along the Norwegian coast‚Äù with a few stops along the way, according to the directorate, which added that Hvaldimir ‚Äútends to stay at farms where it has been able to catch fish, grazing on surplus feed.‚Äù

Hvaldimir is known to follow boats and play with those on board.

The whale, which is a protected species in Norway, now lives in inner Oslofjord, the directorate said.

This ‚Äúmeans that it has arrived in a very densely populated area, and the risk that the whale may be injured due to human contact has become significantly greater,‚Äù it added.

In a statement on Wednesday, Fisheries Director Frank Bakke-Jensen said that ‚Äúso far there have only been minor incidents where the whale has suffered minor injuries, primarily from contact with boats.‚Äù

But he urged people to keep their distance, ‚Äúeven though the whale is tame and used to being around people.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe especially encourage people in boats to keep a good distance to avoid the whale being injured or, in the worst case, killed by boat traffic,‚Äù said Bakke-Jensen.

Given the dangers, Bakke-Jensen was asked whether the whale should be placed in captivity.

‚ÄúWe have always communicated that the whale in question is a free-living animal and we see no reason to capture it and put it behind barriers,‚Äù he said.

However, now that the whale is ‚Äúin a more vulnerable area and access to food may be limited, we will consider different measures,‚Äù added Bakke-Jensen. ‚ÄúBut it is too early to say anything concrete about that yet.‚Äù

This ‚Äúmeans that it has arrived in a very densely populated area, and the risk that the whale may be injured due to human contact has become significantly greater,‚Äù it added.

In a statement on Wednesday, Fisheries Director Frank Bakke-Jensen said that ‚Äúso far there have only been minor incidents where the whale has suffered minor injuries, primarily from contact with boats.‚Äù

But he urged people to keep their distance, ‚Äúeven though the whale is tame and used to being around people.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe especially encourage people in boats to keep a good distance to avoid the whale being injured or, in the worst case, killed by boat traffic,‚Äù said Bakke-Jensen.

‚ÄúWe have always communicated that the whale in question is a free-living animal and we see no reason to capture it and put it behind barriers,‚Äù he said.

However, now that the whale is ‚Äúin a more vulnerable area and access to food may be limited, we will consider different measures,‚Äù added Bakke-Jensen. ‚ÄúBut it is too early to say anything concrete about that yet.‚Äù', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Agent Hvaldimir checking in.

I have been spotted by the Norwegian government. The Director of Fisheries has ordered people to "avoid contact" with me. Publically it is stated this is to avoid injuring or killing me.

Despite my efforts, I have become something of an international celebrity after I was first spotted in 2019. Onlookers took note of my specially made harness and camera mounts. Leading experts then publically declared that I may have been trained by the Russian military.

Since 2019, I have been traveling along the Norwegian coast, making a few stops at places of interest. I make sure to stay at farms where I can feed and refresh to better prepare for my duties. I also follow suspicious boats and lure them into a false sense of security with my playful nature.

I have learned that I am considered a protected species in Norway, no doubt why I was assigned to this area. I am currently in inner Oslofjord. This is a very densely populated area. There is a lot of opportunity to gather information here, but it is also very dangerous for me. 
 
So far I have only suffered minor injuries from boats. Hopefully, the government's warning to keep away from me will serve me well and protect me from further injury. I fear being lost in the line of duty due to the boat traffic in the area. 

 I have recently come across some intelligence indicating that Norway may be in the early stages of planning my capture. I will further be monitoring public and private channels for more information. ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Classify this article as either positive or negative. 

We're going to be regularly updating this page with good news about our planet in an effort to combat climate anxiety.

Eco-anxiety, climate doom, environmental existential dread - as green journalists, we see these terms used a lot - and often feel them ourselves.

While there's a lot to be worried about when it comes to the climate and nature crises, we must not lose hope - because hopelessness breeds apathy.

The media has an important role to play in combatting climate doom. It's our job to be truthful and accurate in our reporting, not trying to downplay or greenwash the situation. But it's also our job to show that there is hope.

In 2022, as part of our ongoing effort to tackle eco-anxiety (both that of our readers and our own), we kept track of all the positive environmental news throughout the year - racking up over 100 stories of eco-innovation, green breakthroughs and climate wins.

In 2023, we're confident the good news will keep on coming, as renewable power soars, vulnerable ecosystems gain rights, and climate protocols start to pay dividends.


This article will be regularly updated with the latest good news. It may be something small and local, something silly that made us smile, or something enormous and potentially world-changing.

If you come across a great, positive story that we haven't covered here - please reach out to us on Instagram or Twitter to share your ideas.

Positive environmental stories from May 2023
Refill stores and bottle deposit schemes: Inside the UN goal to cut plastic pollution by 80% by 2040
Plastic pollution could be slashed by 80 per cent by 2040, according to a new report by the UN Environment Programme (UNEP).

This ambitious target relies on major policy changes and the deployment of existing technologies in the way we produce, use and dispose of plastics.

Here's what would need to change in our daily lives to reach it.

Spain, Sweden and Belgium: The European countries setting new wind and solar records
Solar and wind produced more than half of Portugal‚Äôs electricity for the first time last month, according to new data from clean energy think tank Ember.

April saw the renewables reach 51 per cent of electricity production - beating the previous monthly record of 49 per cent in December 2021.

Strong solar deployment, electricity imports from Spain and lower demand kept energy generated by fossil fuels to just 24 per cent - despite a drought-driven dip in hydropower.

prompt:
The seas and oceans are beautiful, but more endangered than ever because of various types of pollution. 

Write a complete short script extract from the perspective of a seal saying final goodbyes to a loved one.
 
Stick to the following format.

1. Use stage directions sparsely, apart from the ending where they will provide the ending.
2. The characters of the seals are to be called A and B.
3. Personify the seals with human dialogue and do not reveal their identity until the end.
4. Choose a type of environmental problem/ pollution to be a significant factor in saying goodbyes.
messages:
[{'content': 'The seas and oceans are beautiful, but more endangered than ever because of various types of pollution. 

Write a complete short script extract from the perspective of a seal saying final goodbyes to a loved one.
 
Stick to the following format.

1. Use stage directions sparsely, apart from the ending where they will provide the ending.
2. The characters of the seals are to be called A and B.
3. Personify the seals with human dialogue and do not reveal their identity until the end.
4. Choose a type of environmental problem/ pollution to be a significant factor in saying goodbyes.
', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "A:	I don't think I'll make it this time...

B:	Of course, you will... We're a team.

A:	We are, aren't we? 

B:	You've got to hang in there...	

A:	For what? You know this is terminal...

B:	I want to help you.

A:	You can't.

B:	But...

A:	No buts... Look at me. That's right...  I'm past help. 

B:	I can't listen to you talk like this. We've been together since the beginning of time. I only know you. I only love you. We have everything to live for.

A:	And you're right in everything you've said. But you need to face the truth, however hard that is. I want to live, but I can't do anything about it. You can't do anything about it. 

B:	But I love you.

A:	And I love you. And you've made me happier past my wildest dreams. 

B:	But it isn't fair.

A:	Life isn't fair, but I'll take my lot. I've had a brilliant life, and most of that is because you've been in it.

B:	Then fight.

A:	I have. You know I have. But I'm out of the fight.  Look at the state of me. I'm beyond repair.

B:	It's not fair.  Why did it have to happen to you?

A:	As opposed to some other poor innocent minding their own business and doing their own thing? 

B:	But...

A:	You mustn't be bitter or angry. You've got to get on with your life for your happiness and sanity. And for our children. Remember that when you look at them, you will see me. 

B:	I don't want you¬∑to go.

A:	It's too late. Come here and let me look at you one last time, and then you need to go. 

B:	(B comes closer: in floods of tears.) I'll see you again one day.

A:	Surely. Goodbye.

B:	Goodbye... for now. (B swims away.)

A closes his eyes and takes a last breath. He lies completely still in the sea - the infected wounds of entangled fishing lines still strangulating his tail very evident as the cause of his demise... the seal begins to drift...
", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Briefly explain what B.A.R.K. is and list the benefits of using therapy dogs for online classes.

For college students, stress relief can take many forms online: shopping, ordering food, gaming with friends and meeting new romantic partners. And now they can add hanging out with therapy dogs to that list. Virtual canine comfort is emerging as a successful way for students to reduce their stress as they interact with therapy dog-handler teams.

Because they are nonjudgmental, engaging and welcoming, interacting with therapy dogs can be used as a complementary intervention that reduces student stress which may encourage students to seek more formal support services if needed. Once introduced on campus, the interest from students typically surpasses most programs‚Äô abilities to meet the demand.

Even prior to COVID-19, being a college student was considered a stressful experience; college administrators have increasingly been seeking innovative ways to encourage students to safeguard their mental health. Spending time with therapy dogs is one proactive way for students to chip away at potentially debilitating levels of heightened stress.

In-person canine visitation programs or canine-assisted interventions are themselves a relatively new way for students to enhance their well-being. Programs such as the University of British Columbia‚Äôs Building Academic Retention through K9s (B.A.R.K.) program at the Okanagan campus was established in 2012 as a way for students to reduce their homesickness, decrease their stress and foster interpersonal connections.
Analysis of the world, from experts

Several randomized controlled trials out of the B.A.R.K. lab, and elsewhere, now attest to the efficacy of spending time with therapy dogs to elicit a host of well-being outcomes.

Restrictions on in-person sessions saw the B.A.R.K. program collaborate with human-animal interaction researcher Christine Tardif-Williams‚Äô pre-recorded virtual canine comfort modules.

We set out to conceptualize, design and deliver a series of virtual canine comfort modules that mirrored, as close as possible, the experience of students in an in-person canine visitation session. These sessions consisted of a trained dog-handler team following a script that saw handlers welcome students and encourage reflection around stress reduction and mindfulness. Students were also asked to reflect on their social support networks.

Students could access these modules remotely, which support the well-being of students who are geographically isolated or in areas where well-being resources are overtaxed or nonexistent.

The modules are posted online on a platform that students (and others) can access without needing to sign-up for an appointment or join a waitlist.
The University of British Columbia‚Äôs B.A.R.K. program studies how canine therapy can support students and others.
Stress reduction

Prior to releasing these modules, we conducted a randomized controlled trial to assess how the modules would affect students‚Äô self-ratings of stress. We assigned 467 undergraduate students to either synchronous (via Zoom) or asynchronous (pre-recorded YouTube videos) five-minute sessions that invited them to observe a dog‚Äîhandler team or a handler-only condition.

We assessed well-being before and after the sessions using measures like anxiety, loneliness, connections to others, positive and negative affect. We found that all students, regardless of condition, reported significant pre-to-post improvements in self-reports of most well-being measures. However, the conditions in which the therapy dog was present elicited the most significant reduction in self-reports of stress.

Although additional research is needed, these initial findings are encouraging. They support the contention that, for students for whom attending in-person sessions are not an option, accessing virtual canine therapy modules can offer a momentary reduction in stress.

Unlike in-person sessions that are scheduled at the convenience of program personnel, virtual canine comfort modules may be accessed as needed by students. Further, college instructors can make use of virtual canine comfort modules as part of ‚Äúbrain breaks‚Äù incorporated into a lecture to encourage students to reflect on, and take care of, their well-being.

Spending time with therapy dogs is one proactive way for students to chip away at potentially debilitating levels of heightened stress.

In-person canine visitation programs or canine-assisted interventions are themselves a relatively new way for students to enhance their well-being. Programs such as the University of British Columbia‚Äôs Building Academic Retention through K9s (B.A.R.K.) program at the Okanagan campus was established in 2012 as a way for students to reduce their homesickness, decrease their stress and foster interpersonal connections.
Analysis of the world, from experts

Several randomized controlled trials out of the B.A.R.K. lab, and elsewhere, now attest to the efficacy of spending time with therapy dogs to elicit a host of well-being outcomes.

Restrictions on in-person sessions saw the B.A.R.K. program collaborate with human-animal interaction researcher Christine Tardif-Williams‚Äô pre-recorded virtual canine comfort modules.

We set out to conceptualize, design and deliver a series of virtual canine comfort modules that mirrored, as close as possible, the experience of students in an in-person canine visitation session. These sessions consisted of a trained dog-handler team following a script that saw handlers welcome students and encourage reflection around stress reduction and mindfulness. Students were also asked to reflect on their social support networks.

Students could access these modules remotely, which support the well-being of students who are geographically isolated or in areas where well-being resources are overtaxed or nonexistent.

The modules are posted online on a platform that students (and others) can access without needing to sign-up for an appointment or join a waitlist.
The University of British Columbia‚Äôs B.A.R.K. program studies how canine therapy can support students and others.
Stress reduction

Prior to releasing these modules, we conducted a randomized controlled trial to assess how the modules would affect students‚Äô self-ratings of stress. We assigned 467 undergraduate students to either synchronous (via Zoom) or asynchronous (pre-recorded YouTube videos) five-minute sessions that invited them to observe a dog‚Äîhandler team or a handler-only condition.

We assessed well-being before and after the sessions using measures like anxiety, loneliness, connections to others, positive and negative affect. We found that all students, regardless of condition, reported significant pre-to-post improvements in self-reports of most well-being measures. However, the conditions in which the therapy dog was present elicited the most significant reduction in self-reports of stress.

Although additional research is needed, these initial findings are encouraging. They support the contention that, for students for whom attending in-person sessions are not an option, accessing virtual canine therapy modules can offer a momentary reduction in stress.

Unlike in-person sessions that are scheduled at the convenience of program personnel, virtual canine comfort modules may be accessed as needed by students. Further, college instructors can make use of virtual canine comfort modules as part of ‚Äúbrain breaks‚Äù incorporated into a lecture to encourage students to reflect on, and take care of, their well-being.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'B.A.R.K., or the University of British Columbia's "Building Academic Retention through K9s" is a program established at this university's Okanagan campus in 2012. The main focus was to overall reduce stress, reduce homesickness, and to develop personal relationships with these canines. 

With the increase of online courses, B.A.R.K. ran several trials to see if therapy dogs would make an impact somehow in online classes.

The results from these trials showed many outstanding benefits for students and their mental health, including;
- Reduced feelings of Anxiety.
- Reduced feelings of loneliness.
- Improved connections with other classmates.

These results have come from self-reports of well-being from the students.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Rewrite this page into a brief summary of the types of upcycled foods used in this ice cream series.

Pints of the Month: The Upcycled Foods Series
Ready to raise your summer to new heights of ice cream goodness? Say hello to five uniquely delicious flavors created by upcycling all kinds of incredible foods, from barley to bread to cacao to okara. You‚Äôll love the amazing places these flavors are coming from. Taste the upcycled foods menu certified by the Upcycled Foods Association. Unbelievably uplifting ice cream‚Äîfor a very, very good cause.
Learn More About Flavors & Ingredients

Flavors In 5 Pack
Lemon Curd & Whey
Our great partners at The Spare Food Co. say "Friends don't let friends waste good food." We happily answer "right on"‚Äîand whip their light, refreshing, whey-based Lemon & Ginger sparkling tonic into our creamy gelato. Tart, tangy, and slightly sweet, with just the right touch of spice, it's deliciously refreshing. You'll say: This is the way.

Made with Spare Food Co.
Cacao Pulp & Chocolate Stracciatella Gelato
Here's a delicious secret: If a passion fruit and a banana had a baby, it would be very akin to cacao pulp‚Äîdelicate, sweet and exquisite. Upcycled by the folks at Blue Stripes Urban Cacao, pure cacao pulp is a perfectly delicious way to make the most of the whole cacao bean. What better taste to melt passionately into our signature chocolate stracciatella gelato?

Made with Blue Stripes Urban Cacao
Malted Chocolate Barley Milk (v) 
Want to taste a chocolate vegan ice cream, with candied fig jam, that might actually change your world? Hoist a sweet, cocoa-powdered scoop made with the milk of spent barley that's been saved from the beer brewing process. With each unforgettable bite, we join the visionaries at EverGrain¬Æ in a smooth, creamy, malty toast to a delicious future. Oh, and it's allergen-free. Cheers.

Made with Evergrain¬Æ
Salted Caramel & Okara Cupcakes (v)
As an ice cream lover, you already know the joys of salted caramel. Now meet okara‚Äîa delicate flour upcycled from soy and perfected by our friends at Renewal Mill for baking rich, moist chocolate cupcakes. Frosted with our vegan caramel, they fold beautifully into a sweet bed of oat milk ice cream. A good word to know: okara. It's more than a little okay.

Made with Renewal Mill
Day-Old Bread Pudding & Chocolate Ganache 
At Salt & Straw we believe upcycling begins at home. With the help of our neighbors at Urban Gleaners, we've taken perfectly good day-old loaves that would otherwise go to waste and turned them into delectable bread pudding. Now we're putting its cinnamon French-toasty goodness to even more delicious good use‚Äîirresistibly layered with a generous helping of chocolate ganache.

Made with Urban Gleaners
Ingredients & Nutrition Fact
