prompt: Write a series of 5 tweets for tourism in Night Vale and 5 tweets for news updates
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a series of 5 tweets for tourism in Night Vale and 5 tweets for news updates', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': '1. To all you folks out there wondering if Night Vale deserves a spot on your summer road trip this year, the answer is yes! Night Vale is a perfectly safe, friendly community, and we eagerly welcome visitors at all times of the year when the Glow Cloud isn't here.
2. We've gotten some questions from tourists about strange phenomena they may or may not have seen, but no need to worry! For 30 hours out of the year, Night Vale is completely free of all strange phenomena.
3. Top tourist attractions in Night Vale to check out include the invisible clock tower, the abandoned mine shaft, the abandoned missile silo, the harbor and waterfront recreation center, the old town, and definitely not the dog park.
4. We'd like to take this time to honor all those that have died in gruesome manners this last tourism season. For the next five minutes, all 132 of you will be remembered.
5. Looking for family-friendly travel destinations? Try Night Vale! Our little community is always eager to meet new human and non-human visitors alike, so consider adding our little desert hometown to your travel plans.

1. The Sheriff's secret police are currently looking for a local cryptid accused of stealing the invisible clock tower. The culprit is described as a giant Mothman with two wings, two glowing red eyes, two arms, and two legs.
2. For the foreseeable future, please follow the temporary detour on Oak Street as a large, raging worm has taken up residence there and is not letting cars pass through.
3. To avoid instant incineration, citizens are urged to avoid walking, breathing, or being in the general vicinity of any of the angels that live at Old Lady Josie's place. Rumor has it they are very mad right now.
4. Today's traffic update is this: No traffic exists anymore without Night Vale. What do you mean, "traffic"? That's not a thing that exists. And if it did, it certainly wouldn't exist in Night Vale.
5. The Mayor has announced that instead of an election, she will remain mayor for an indefinite period as she "seeks to free Night Vale of the tyranny brought on by general elections and democracy".', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Write a short children's story explaining where watermelon comes from. This should be geared toward preschool - 1st-grade audiences.
messages: [{'content': "Write a short children's story explaining where watermelon comes from. This should be geared toward preschool - 1st-grade audiences.", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Sally\'s cheeks were rosy and RED, just like the hair on her head. 1 - 2 -3 -4 -5, she counted the fruits that helped them survive. 1-2-3-4-5, not only did they help them survive but they helped her family to thrive. "Where does this watermelon come from?" Sally asked Mom. Mom knew everything then. She knew how and when. "Do you see this skin, shiny and GREEN? Do you see what I mean? I knew this melon was good. It came from a store in our neighborhood,"  Sally had to think about this for a while. She stared out of the window at the sky so BLUE. Mom said it, so it must be true. "How did it get to the store? Where was it before?" " It came on a truck that could have been BLACK,  WHITE, or BROWN. It came from far away and was brought to our town."  "What about before it was on the truck? Do you know? Is there any such luck?" Sally whispered, hoping to know. "It came from the place where they grow. A place called a farm, where workers have a strong arm. They grow lots of things, ORANGE, PURPLE, and YELLOW. We owe a lot to the farming fellow," Mom could tell that Sally wanted to know more. This curious daughter, she did adore. "The farmers put a seed in the ground; it can\'t have any weeds around. It is covered with dirt, so it won\'t get hurt. Water helps it to sprout and grow. So does the sunshine, you know?" This all sounded true, but Sally wanted to know what she could do, to be a farmer on her own, to have a watermelon that she had grown. Mom cut the melon open wide to show Sally what was inside. She saw a seed, exactly what Sally would need. They went to the yard, where the earth was scarred.  They shoveled a mound with the dirt they had found. The seed was tucked into a dirt bed, where it could be a sleepy head.  They watered the mound, one with no weeds around. The hardest part was to wait, to wait for the date when they could celebrate. As time went by slowly, the watermelon did grow so lowly. One day came time, when Sally picked her watermelon and declared, "This is all mine!"', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: What are three class archetypes in RPGs? Give a short description of their attributes and the attire they wear. Give an example of each in a different video game.
messages:
[{'content': 'What are three class archetypes in RPGs? Give a short description of their attributes and the attire they wear. Give an example of each in a different video game.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "No problem, here are three class archetypes in RPGs!

1. Warrior - Warriors are possibly the most used class in RPGs. It is often known as the default choice and the warrior is typically known for their strength and ability to wield a sword. The warrior normally dons armor made out of some form of metal and also wields a sword and sometimes a shield. They have a muscular build compared to other members of the party and sometimes their opponents. They are not the most clever but can certainly get the job done, most of the time with brute force. 

Edelgard from Fire Emblem Three Houses is a more recent example of the Warrior class.

2. Mage - Mages are probably the 2nd most common class. They typically wield a stave, staff, or some wand-type object but can also sometimes wield different weapons such as a hammer or knives. Their armor is typically a cloak and their defense is oftentimes weaker than other characters. Their magic is often consumable and can run out so they will either need to rest at an inn or use an ether to restore their MP. Black mages typically use offensive magic against their opponents such as fire or lightning while white mages use healing magic like Cure and can also heal status ailments such as poison.

Vivi in Final Fantasy IX is one of the most iconic characters in the RPG genre.

3. Thief - Thieves are most well-known for their speed as well as their ability to steal. This is typically a command that they will have from the moment they join your party. They are normally a more slender build and typically wield knives. They wear cloaks, sometimes with hoods and often prefer to hide and may also want to hide their identity. They are known much more for their support abilities than being able to attack like a Warrior, for instance. In certain games, thieves can steal very rare pieces of equipment from bosses or difficult enemies. Thieves have also been known to poison their enemies.

Therion in Octopath Traveler 1 is an example of a thief. He can steal from enemies while you're in towns, which can be very helpful.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: What are some vet-approved homemade dog food recipes?
messages:
[{'content': 'What are some vet-approved homemade dog food recipes?', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Below is a general starting point for a recipe adapted from veterinarian Greg Martinez by The Wildest's Claudia Kaawczynska. She points out that this slow-cooker-made recipe is higher in protein, with about 50% dry matter, and lower in fat, with about 10% dry matter than you'd find in most recipes. She adds that, since every pet has very specific needs, you should only use this recipe as a starting point, then talk things over with your pet's doctor for more specifics suited to them. 

The ingredients you will need are: 

* 3/4ths minimum to 1 pound maximum of cubed, skinless, boneless chicken breasts or thighs. (Substitute with lean beef, turkey, or fish if necessary or preferred)

* 1 ounce minimum to 3 ounces maximum of preferably chicken liver, hearts, or gizzards. Other animal livers are acceptable.

* If this meal accounts for more than 10% of a dog's daily diet, include 1 tablespoon of bone meal (or 1,500 mg) per pound of meat

* 1 to 2 whole eggs for a healthy source of fat 

* 8 ounces of brown or white rice

* 16 ounces of green beans

* Water

Take your slow cooker and add in the diced chicken, the chicken liver, gizzards, and hearts, along with the eggs. You will then add the bone meal, rice, and green beans. Denser ingredients should be at the bottom, with the lightest ingredients on top. Since the amount of water you'll need to use depends on how long you choose to cook the ingredients and how big your slow cooker is, there isn't a specific amount you need to add. Try to fill the cooker to about two-thirds of the way full, but not less than halfway, and if possible, use a six-or-seven quart cooker. When you add in the water, you should try to submerge the ingredients without fully covering them. Then, stir the contents.

Put on the lid and set the temperature to low. Leave your crockpot on for around 4 to 8 hours, only as long as needed for the chicken breasts to fall apart. As it's cooking, you can stir and add water to make the stew moister or drier, but keep in mind that you can lose up to 20 to 30 minutes of cooking time if the lid is removed. ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Write a melodramatic short story about the loss of friendship. It should be about a fisherman, named Finnegan, who catches a fish that can talk and befriends it. They should continue their friendship in secret for months before the fisherman decides to share his friend with the other fishermen at home, who ultimately take the talking fish away to reap a reward. Make it exactly 400 words.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a melodramatic short story about the loss of friendship. It should be about a fisherman, named Finnegan, who catches a fish that can talk and befriends it. They should continue their friendship in secret for months before the fisherman decides to share his friend with the other fishermen at home, who ultimately take the talking fish away to reap a reward. Make it exactly 400 words.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'It was not unlike yesterday for Finnegan. Nor would it be unlike the next day, he figured. The clouds were thick and low, spreading the same gray they always cast on the horizon where the Atlantic meets the sky. The two entities were similar, Finnegan believed: neither were as blue as the storybooks said they should be, and both seem endless. Finnegan‚Äôs boat thrust away from shore in search of amberjack fish. Finnegan‚Äôs boat was not big nor small, but it was large enough to carry his haul to the cannery and small enough to make a weaker man nervous about any storm. It would take much more than that to make Finnegan nervous, however.

Reaching his fishing spot, dropped lures off the starboard side and prayed the decorative barnacles would not cut his lines today. Before making it back into the cabin to escape the rain, one of his rods began dancing violently. Controlling the wild vibrations and manning the reel, Finnegan fought with whatever was attached to the hook. It was big, he knew that. Winning the battle, Finnegan saw an amberjack with the brightest yellow stripe he had ever seen on the silver-bodied fish. Wrestling the fish aboard, it stopped fighting and seemed to stare directly into Finnegan‚Äôs eyes. Then, it spoke.

Over the next few months, Finnegan kept the speaking fish secret from other fishermen. Unsure why he kept it to himself, maybe it was because he had little else to call his own. His boat was financed, and his catches had to be exchanged for a small shack he rented. The fish would learn things about Finnegan he thought would never be shared. As much as Finnegan wanted to hide the fish, the fish wanted to meet more people. Therefore, it was reluctantly agreed upon that Finnegan would bring the talking fish back to the docks.

Reaching the docks, Finnegan gave a nervous nod to the fish and tied off the boat. Fishermen approached to see his daily catch. Everyone knew Finnegan to be a lonely man, but he was never one to talk to himself‚Äîalthough he was speaking. His peers realized he was communicating with a fish and, before Finnegan could react, he was restrained, and the fish was taken from him. Apparently, the fish could fetch a great prize on the market. Finnegan never saw his friend again.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Rewrite this for a 6-year-old child. Rearrange the sentences to make fewer paragraphs.

Why did dinosaurs go extinct?
Around 75% of Earth's animals, including dinosaurs, suddenly died out at the same point in time. So how was this global mass extinction caused by a rock hurtling into the coast of Central America?

Paul explains, 'The asteroid hit at high velocity and effectively vaporised. It made a huge crater, so in the immediate area there was total devastation. A huge blast wave and heatwave went out and it threw vast amounts of material up into the atmosphere.

'It sent soot travelling all around the world. It didn't completely block out the Sun, but it reduced the amount of light that reached the Earth's surface. So it had an impact on plant growth.'

Like dominos, this trailed up the food chain, causing the ecosystem to collapse. The reduction in plant life had a huge impact on herbivores' ability to survive, which in turn meant that carnivores would also have suffered from having less food available.

Breeding seasons would have been shorter and conditions harsher. All living things would have been affected in some way, both on land and in the ocean.

'There is a lot of discussion over the actual kill mechanism and how long that period lasted. There are still a lot of unknowns. But it was a massive event affecting all life on Earth, from microorganisms all the way through to dinosaurs,' says Paul.

The casualty list is long. Among them, ammonites, some microscopic plankton, and large marine reptiles all died out.

But the loss made room for the beginnings of the modern world.
messages:
[{'content': "Rewrite this for a 6-year-old child. Rearrange the sentences to make fewer paragraphs.

Why did dinosaurs go extinct?
Around 75% of Earth's animals, including dinosaurs, suddenly died out at the same point in time. So how was this global mass extinction caused by a rock hurtling into the coast of Central America?

Paul explains, 'The asteroid hit at high velocity and effectively vaporised. It made a huge crater, so in the immediate area there was total devastation. A huge blast wave and heatwave went out and it threw vast amounts of material up into the atmosphere.

'It sent soot travelling all around the world. It didn't completely block out the Sun, but it reduced the amount of light that reached the Earth's surface. So it had an impact on plant growth.'

Like dominos, this trailed up the food chain, causing the ecosystem to collapse. The reduction in plant life had a huge impact on herbivores' ability to survive, which in turn meant that carnivores would also have suffered from having less food available.

Breeding seasons would have been shorter and conditions harsher. All living things would have been affected in some way, both on land and in the ocean.

'There is a lot of discussion over the actual kill mechanism and how long that period lasted. There are still a lot of unknowns. But it was a massive event affecting all life on Earth, from microorganisms all the way through to dinosaurs,' says Paul.

The casualty list is long. Among them, ammonites, some microscopic plankton, and large marine reptiles all died out.

But the loss made room for the beginnings of the modern world.", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Why did the dinosaurs die?

A long time ago, many different animals lived on our planet that no longer live now. Dinosaurs were some of these animals and at one point something very sad happened. All of them suddenly died. We say they went extinct. Most likely this happened because a very large rock from space hit our planet. We call this kind of rock an asteroid.

The asteroid was travelling very fast through space and when it hit the Earth, it made a giant hole called a crater. Everything was destroyed and a lot of black powder called soot went flying into the air and all around the planet. There was so much of this black powder that the Sun was blocked out a little. It wasn't bright enough on Earth for the plants to grow normally anymore.

Because the plants couldn't grow well, all other living beings were affected as well. The animals that only eat plants didn't have enough food to survive. Because there were not many plant-eating animals, the meat-eating animals also didn't have enough food anymore. The conditions were becoming more and more difficult for all living creatures on land and in the sea.

Because this happened so long ago, it's hard to know everything, but we know for sure that it was a very big event and that it affected all organisms from the tiniest living beings all the way to dinosaurs. The list of animals that died during that time is very long. But even though it was the end of many things, it was also the beginning of many new things.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Use 350 words to describe the hero of a fiction novel. The genre is science fiction. The setting is on a fictional harsh ice planet called, well you make it up, and the hero is preparing to go hunting a large animal native to the planet. He is competent and careful.
messages:
[{'content': 'Use 350 words to describe the hero of a fiction novel. The genre is science fiction. The setting is on a fictional harsh ice planet called, well you make it up, and the hero is preparing to go hunting a large animal native to the planet. He is competent and careful.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "209003 was its name. But the colonists called it Mesiea‚Äôs Bite. Her heart was bitter, and her icy tundra was unforgiving of carelessness, or even simple bad luck. Mesiea would kill you if she could. Most of the planet remained uncharted. The cold wreaked havoc on machines and travel was difficult, preventing widespread exploration.

The dawn light reflected faintly on the snow-covered peaks. Soon, as the planet warmed, the Woolies would come down to the frosty plains to graze. Alistair prepared for the hunt, his economical movements a display of controlled elegance. The thick, white thermal gear he wore would keep him warm and hide him from view. The native Woolies had sharp eyesight and an even sharper sense of smell and provided a critical source of food for the colonists. 

He slung his energy bow, an elegant weapon both powerful and quiet, an ancient art reborn for use on a hostile planet. The slender bolts of energy it fired resembled arrows only in the barest sense. They maintained their form just long enough to puncture the target. Alistair could configure the shape of the energy bolts to cause maximum damage to large prey or a more delicate but still deadly missile for smaller game. Today, he was opting for a heavy bolt. 

He finished strapping his gear on and pushed open the heavy door. A lighter version of an airlock door, it was superb for keeping Mesiea‚Äôs bitter chill out of the habitat. His storm-gray eyes scanned the white expanse of untamed wilderness. He lowered his face shield and instantly the blinding glare subsided and he could detect variations in the landscape. Subtle slopes and crags revealed themselves. It would be a long hike before he was far enough from the habitat to reach the Woolies' grazing area. He checked his equipment once more. Equipment failures were fatal for the careless. His understanding of the terrain, a sign of his survival skills, allowed him to move through it effectively. His heart soared. He allowed himself to feel his fierce love for the icy planet, then set his feelings aside. Respect, not love, would keep him alive today.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
List the protections provided to plants by the Endangered Species Act in a comma-separated list. Please make your answer a complete sentence. 
This is the text to reference:

By being placed on the Endangered Species List, the twistflower is almost guaranteed to survive, since the rate at which species‚Äô declines have been stopped after being placed on the ESL is 99%, the highest of any such national conservation program worldwide.

This protection was also doled out to the prostrate milkweed, which received 661 acres of critical habitat protection. It is illegal to cut, damage, harvest, or transport either flower under federal law.

MORE ESL SUCCESS STORIES: Two Channel Island Plants Found Nowhere Else are Off Endangered Species List and Now Flourishing

‚ÄúProtecting prostrate milkweed is a big deal for the monarch butterflies who lay their eggs on these plants as they fly through Texas after spending the winter in Mexico,‚Äù said Tierra Curry, a senior scientist at the Center for Biological Diversity.

Unlike the bracted twistflower, the milkweed is found at the moment exclusively in the terrain surrounding the banks of the Rio Grande, in Starr and Zapata counties.

Monarch populations in Mexico were counted as having increased several years in a row, vaulting the theory that it was simply a single boom year. Now, food resources like the Texas milkweed will be more valuable than ever.

prompt: I am trying to come up with some yummy dessert ideas. Can you brainstorm some ideas for me? I‚Äôm allergic to nuts, so recipes with nuts in it won‚Äôt work. I love strawberries and chocolate though.
messages:
[{'content': 'I am trying to come up with some yummy dessert ideas. Can you brainstorm some ideas for me? I‚Äôm allergic to nuts, so recipes with nuts in it won‚Äôt work. I love strawberries and chocolate though.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Sure! Here are some unique and delicious dessert ideas you can try with strawberries and chocolate and no nuts in it:

1. Strawberry Bars Covered in Chocolate: This delectable treat combines the sweetness of fresh strawberries with the richness of the chocolate. It's the perfect snack for when you're in the mood for something sweet and a little bit indulgent. With succulent strawberries enrobed in silky chocolate, these bars are a match made in heaven.

2. Strawberry Trifle with Brownie: Layers of juicy strawberries, decadent brownie chunks, and velvety whipped cream make this trifle a showstopper. You can layer this luscious dessert with soft and moist brownies, creamy vanilla pudding, and fresh sliced strawberries. It's a dessert that will make your taste buds dance with joy!

3. Chocolate Pudding with Strawberries: It‚Äôs a classic dessert that's been given a fruity update. Rich, chocolatey goodness is elevated with bright bursts of fresh strawberries in a luxurious pudding. The smooth and silky pudding is mixed with juicy, ripe strawberries that give it an extra flavor. It's a dessert that's sure to satisfy your sweet tooth.

4. Chocolate-Strawberry Duo in Truffles: Enjoy this tantalizing treat that blends the best of both worlds ‚Äì luscious chocolate and juicy strawberries ‚Äì into bite-sized truffles. prompt:
Rewrite this song into a letter, to John, from Taylor. Not all of the lyrics have to be included and can be made literal, just get the point across and have it be like a breakup letter.

Long were the nights when
My days once revolved around you
Counting my footsteps
Praying the floor won't fall through again
And my mother accused me of losing my mind
But I swore I was fine
You paint me a blue sky
Then go back and turn it to rain
And I lived in your chess game
But you changed the rules everyday
Wondering which version of you I might get on the phone tonight
Well, I stopped pickin' up and this song is to let you know why

[Chorus]
Dear John, I see it all now that you're gone
Don't you think I was too young to be messed with?
The girl in the dress cried the whole way home
I should've known

[Verse 2]
Well, maybe it's me
And my blind optimism to blame
Or maybe it's you and your sick need
To give love and take it away
And you'll add my name to your long list of traitors
Who don't understand
And I look back in regret how I ignored when they said
"Run as fast as you can"

[Chorus]
Dear John, I see it all now that you're gone
Don't you think I was too young to be messed with?
The girl in the dress cried the whole way home
Dear John, I see it all now, it was wrong
Don't you think nineteen's too young
To be played by your dark, twisted games when I loved you so?
I should've known

[Bridge]
You are an expert at sorry and keeping lines blurry
Never impressed by me acing your tests
All the girls that you've run dry have tired lifeless eyes
'Cause you burned them out
But I took your matches before fire could catch me
So don't look now
I'm shining like fireworks over your sad empty town
Oh, oh

[Chorus]
Dear John, I see it all now that you're gone
Don't you think I was too young to be messed with?
The girl in the dress cried the whole way home
I see it all now that you're gone
Don't you think I was too young to be messed with?
The girl in the dress wrote you a song
You should've known

[Outro]
You should've known
Don't you think I was too young?
You should've known

You should've known', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Dear John,

I stopped answering your calls and I'm writing this letter to let you know why. I can't handle not knowing which version of you will be on the phone anymore. I'm done with the sleepless nights, my days revolving around you. I'm done counting my every step and praying that I'm enough for you. I can't keep up with you and your expectations. I should have listened when everyone said to run as fast as I could; when my mother told me I was losing my mind. Should've known I was no different from all the other girls, never even dreaming to meet your standards. I guess my blind optimism in you and being 19 made everything too hard to see at first. Too many nights have I cried over you and I see you for who you are now. I can see it all now that we're apart and you're gone. 

I'm moving on and I'll shine brighter than you ever allowed.

Goodbye,
Taylor", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I'm an art student, and I'm going to be in Scottsdale in May.  What are 5 places I can go that have good art, especially modern art?
messages:
[{'content': "I'm an art student, and I'm going to be in Scottsdale in May.  What are 5 places I can go that have good art, especially modern art?
", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Sure, I can help you with that. Many places in Arizona have interesting modern art, especially in the Phoenix and Scottsdale areas.  Here are some ideas for you to visit in May: 

1. The Phoenix Art Museum, which is not far from Scottsdale, has over 17,000 modern and contemporary works of art. The plus is, if you go with someone who likes other types of art as well, there will be something for everyone. 
2. The Eye Lounge might be perfect for you if you like eclectic places where budding contemporary artists can show off their talent. Featuring many new artists, this is a space that exhibits conceptually stimulating artworks, which inspire discussion and introspection. 
3. If you also like photography, a good option for visiting could be MonOrchid.  It's a split gallery exhibit space, which has the Bokeh Gallery and the Shade Gallery.  The Bokeh Gallery is mainly photographic artwork and digital collages. The Shade Gallery, however, is a significant space containing static and modular walls that can adapt to a variety of exhibitions. This is an ever-changing art space and is well-known by modern art enthusiasts. 
4. Perhaps you should try going to Perihelion Arts, which is a cutting-edge contemporary art gallery/artist collective that was established by Amy Young. The gallery aims to reveal the very best of contemporary art to promote public interest in the arts, with a priority on art that pushes boundaries. This includes folk, surrealism, pop surrealism, outsider, and erotic art.
5. Another option is Oblique Art, a contemporary urban arts space and pop-up gallery located in downtown Phoenix. Obliq Art was established in 2012 intending to showcase exceptional contemporary paintings, photography and mixed media created by local Arizona artists.

These options are some of the most popular options for modern art, but there is more where that came from.  Depending on how long you'll be staying in Scottsdale, you may want to visit even more exhibits. ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I am planning a menu for a group of young people going on a conference and I need a list of easy breakfasts that they can make themselves. Give me about 5 ideas in a numbered list. Add in some vegetarian-friendly options.
messages:
[{'content': 'I am planning a menu for a group of young people going on a conference and I need a list of easy breakfasts that they can make themselves. Give me about 5 ideas in a numbered list. Add in some vegetarian-friendly options.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Sure! Here are some ideas for your breakfasts:

1. Eggs, bacon, mushrooms, and toast - this is a simple fried meal, often called a continental breakfast. Adding mushrooms also make it vegetarian-friendly.
2. Pancakes - pancakes are a simple breakfast option that can be made from scratch or using a mix. Pancakes can be topped with a variety of toppings: syrup, fruit, and peanut butter. Pancakes can also be made with chocolate chips and blueberries cooked right in.
3. French toast - french toast is a hearty meal that is easy to make and can also be topped with different toppings and can be made with a variety of different kinds of bread too.
4. Breakfast burritos - these versatile burritos can be filled with various toppings: eggs, ham, tomatoes, cheese, bell peppers, and potatoes. They are easily made vegetarian, too.
5. Cereal, yogurt and fruit - the simplest breakfast that just requires taking things out of the cupboard and fridge! ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Can you please write me the outline for a children's story about the animals in Africa? Make sure there are lions, elephants, giraffes, and more. I'd like the story to be about the animals all coming together to fight off poachers.
messages:
[{'content': "Can you please write me the outline for a children's story about the animals in Africa? Make sure there are lions, elephants, giraffes, and more. I'd like the story to be about the animals all coming together to fight off poachers. ", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "- The story begins with all of the animals gathered at the drinking well.
- The lions lay out on rocks soaking up the sun. The other animals give them plenty of space.
- The zebras stand in a field grazing and soaking up the sun.
- The mighty elephant stands near a tree picking at leaves.
- The giraffe stands by the elephant picking leaves up high.
- A few crocodiles lay out in the water relaxing.
- There is noise at the tree line, and a truck breaks through.
- Out of the truck come humans with guns and rifles.
- One fires a shot and hits one of the zebras in the leg.
- All the animals scatter, but the zebra that got shot can't move quickly enough and is captured.
- The remaining animals meet up at a hidden grotto.
- They decide to put aside their differences to scare off the poachers and save the zebra.
- They come up with a plan for a surprise attack.
- The next day we see the poacher camp and the captured zebra.
- The animals launch their attack with the elephant in front.
- The zebras stampede herding the poachers toward the truck.
- The giraffe uses his long neck to tower over the poacher truck.
- The lions crowd the poachers forcing them into their trucks.
- The poachers drive off, and the zebra is rescued.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Hi! Please brainstorm 5 social media websites that are good for visual artists to build a following on, I'm a new artist trying to get followers and commissioners, thank you :)
messages:
[{'content': "Hi! Please brainstorm 5 social media websites that are good for visual artists to build a following on, I'm a new artist trying to get followers and commissioners, thank you :)", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Of course! Join one or all of these websites to start building your following:

1. Instagram. Artists love Instagram because the image-only platform greets followers with a gallery of your artwork. You can also share WIPs and other temporary posts with Instagram stories. Use hashtags to increase your visibility and gain followers.
2. Twitter. Start following artists on Twitter to gain a circle in minutes, then share your art with the world. Popular artists can get tens of thousands of likes on a single post.
3. Tumblr. This site is less popular than others, but artists still earn tens of thousands of followers. Tumblr also spotlights posts every day, and if you catch the staff's eye, your work could be one of the highlights. Tumblr's platform permits text, video, and full-sized images.
4. TikTok. Video platforms are a little more complicated, but you can show followers your process, share WIPs, and show off the final piece with filters and music.
5. Facebook. While Facebook's demographic skews older, you can still earn a following--the site has two billion users after all. Your friends and relatives can also easily find your work and promote it to others.

Artists tend to diversify so that they can reach several audiences on multiple platforms. Find the sites that work for you, then start your journey to online fame!", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Rewrite this article to sound like a caveman wrote it:

People suffering from life-changing physical conditions, like losing a limb or paralysis caused by a stroke, often have a long, slow journey to regain function. But advances in digital therapies, using games and virtual reality, can make rehabilitation easier and are encouraging patients to make faster progress.

Amputees can suffer from severe phantom limb pain as well as coordination problems caused by losing an arm or leg. To address this, neurotechnology company MindMaze created a virtual reality experience that fools the patient‚Äôs brain into thinking their severed limb is still attached, helping them to manage the pain.

The company also develops games using body motion capture cameras and movement sensors to rehabilitate patients and restore movement. Thousands have received MindMaze gaming therapy in clinics around the world. And crucially, VR and games are an injection of fun into what could be an uncomfortable, difficult and tiring process.

Stroke patients struggling to recover movement, fine motor skills, and cognitive function can work their way back to fitness with the help of an animated dolphin character in ‚ÄòMindPod‚Äô. The game uses an anti-gravity vest that lifts the arm and makes it easier to control the dolphin in its undersea environment, or even do backflips out of the water.

Games like MindPod are also being used to address degenerative brain conditions such as Alzheimer‚Äôs or Parkinson‚Äôs disease, and dementia. The US Department of Defence has funded a trial to see how it can prevent dementia for war veterans with traumatic brain injury.

Serious physical and neurological disorders mean that therapeutic games need to be built on solid foundations. University of California San Francisco (UCSF) video game research showed that games could be used to help older people improve their cognitive control and multitasking skills.

NeuroRacer was a simple 3D racing game developed at the university that showed how, in just hours, games training could reverse certain negative effects of aging, and might also help with disorders like ADHD and depression.

Now it seems the coronavirus pandemic has accelerated the uptake of gaming therapies. Remote treatments make more sense when there is already reduced contact with doctors. In June 2020, the US Food and Drug Administration approved its first game-based therapeutic device for children with ADHD, the EndeavorRx, based on the UCSF‚Äôs groundbreaking research.

Gaming companies have been looking to develop games for the health and fitness market for more than a decade. Commercial entries, from Kinect and Xbox to Nintendo Ring Fit, show how seriously the video console and gaming industry wants to be involved.

DeepWell Digital Therapeutics has unveiled plans to build on existing games research into ADHD and depression to release its own range. While these games are unlikely to be a replacement for medication or in-person care, they can certainly help fill in gaps in care.

Boston Children‚Äôs Hospital certainly takes the digital therapy trend seriously. Clinicians worked with the Harvard Medical School to create the gaming company Mightier and road test its strategies. The result was gaming technology that showed kids how to handle stressful situations and change their behavior.


The hospital now uses gaming in family therapy and mental health sessions, showing doctors‚Äô commitment to digital therapies. And the games industry is happy to follow suit to make gaming for wellness another option for inpatient treatment.

prompt: I need a limerick, a haiku, and a short poem that rhymes. All should be about birds.
messages:
[{'content': 'I need a limerick, a haiku, and a short poem that rhymes. All should be about birds.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Limerick:
There once was a bird named Blue,
And he never knew what to do.
So he flew through the air, without any care,
And sang doobity, doobity, doobity-do.

Haiku:
My feathers are wet
Welcome rain fell fresh and clean
on dry, dusty land

Poem:
Freely sings the chipper bird 
when trouble comes his way.
He lifts his voice to tell the world 
in time, there will be a better day.

', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Find and list the types of toilet paper for sale:

Strong and smooth
So maybe you're wondering... 

What makes this toilet paper so eco-friendly?

Great question! Did you know traditional supermarket toilet paper is made from cutting down trees? It‚Äôs one of the main causes of deforestation worldwide. That‚Äôs why we make our plastic-free rolls with only 100% recycled fibres or bamboo (a grass, not a tree).

Do they feel weird?

Not at all. We‚Äôve made our rolls as luxe as possible ‚Äì after a wipe and half, you won‚Äôt even remember what the other stuff feels like. Besides, helping reduce deforestation feels pretty great, if you ask us.

Ok, but I'm scared of subscriptions.

We‚Äôve all been burned before. But we promise (like double dog pinky promise) we‚Äôre incredibly flexible and make it easy for you to cancel at any time. Almost too easy - it‚Äôs kind of bad for business.
Choose your subscription

The best part

50% of profits donated to water and sanitation charities

Every wipe helps build toilets and water systems for the billions of people in need. Our subscribers have helped us donate millions to date ‚Äì we‚Äôre incredibly proud of this community.

prompt: I've been hired to develop a line of eco-friendly packing materials. I need potential ideas for sustainable, eco-friendly packaging materials. Can you provide a detailed list of ideas?
messages:
[{'content': "I've been hired to develop a line of eco-friendly packing materials. I need potential ideas for sustainable, eco-friendly packaging materials. Can you provide a detailed list of ideas? ", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Sure! Here are some ideas for eco-friendly, sustainable packaging material: 

1. Edible Packaging:  Develop packaging material made from edible substances, such as seaweed, starch, or fruit peels. This would eliminate waste and provide an eco-friendly alternative to traditional packaging. This idea aligns to reduce waste and offers an innovative solution where packaging can be consumed along with the product, minimizing the effects on the environment.

2. Biodegradable Packaging: Create packaging materials that can easily decompose in natural environments, reducing environmental impact and waste accumulation.  Biodegradable materials break down naturally, reducing waste accumulation in landfills and oceans, while promoting a circular economy. 

3. Plant-based Plastics: Explore the use of bioplastics derived from renewable resources like corn, sugarcane, or algae. These materials have a lower carbon footprint and can be recycled or composted. Using renewable resources for plastic production decreases reliance on fossil fuels and reduces greenhouse gas emissions. 

4. Mushroom Packaging: Investigate the use of mycelium, the vegetative part of mushrooms, as a sustainable packaging material. It is biodegradable, requires fewer resources to produce, and can be molded into various shapes. Mushroom packaging is a biodegradable and sustainable alternative to traditional packaging materials, utilizing agricultural waste as a resource.

5. Minimalist Packaging: Design packaging that minimizes the use of materials and focuses on the essential aspects of product protection. This approach reduces waste and promotes a more sustainable supply chain. By focusing on essential packaging elements, waste is minimized. 

6. Reusable Packaging: Develop a system that encourages consumers to return packaging for reuse, similar to how glass milk bottles were collected and refilled in the past. This approach reduces waste and engages consumers in the sustainability process. This option promotes a circular economy and reduces the overall demand for new packaging materials.

7. Smart Packaging: Explore the integration of sensors or indicators on the packaging that can monitor food freshness, temperature, or quality. This would help reduce waste by providing accurate information to consumers. Providing real-time information about quality and freshness helps prevent food waste by enabling informed decisions.  

8. Upcycled Packaging: Investigate the use of upcycled materials, such as recycled paper or discarded textiles, to create unique and eco-friendly packaging solutions. Using discarded materials for packaging reduces waste and repurposes resources that would otherwise be sent to landfills.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Write a short, casually written, quip blog post about the best way to find audiences on Facebook for serving ads.  Include a title and subtitles.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write a short, casually written, quip blog post about the best way to find audiences on Facebook for serving ads.  Include a title and subtitles. ', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Zuc's Guide to Finding the Perfect Audience

No other component of Facebook instills fear in marketers more than Facebook's algorithm. The mere hint of a change to it sends the best of the best of them into a tailspin. It's a machine-learning, traffic-eating, complex set of codes that knows how to solve problems. On its own. And Zuc has invested a lot of cash into making sure it does a good job.

Naturally, it's pretty smart, too. Way smarter than us. And over the past few years, it's gotten smarter. So smart that it has reduced the effort needed to manage and optimize ads, targeting, bids, and budgets. Can it find you the best audience for targeting your ads? Yes, it can. It just needs data from you.

Feed the Machine.
By far, the easiest and best way to find the perfect audience is to give Facebook your customers and let them figure it out for you. Who better to start with than your existing customers, right? The most effective customer data to feed Facebook is your website traffic generated from Facebook. As you know, you'll need the Facebook Pixel installed on your site to capture this. From there you can create Custom Audiences and use those audiences to create Lookalike Audiences that best mirror your existing customers to find new customers. 

You can also upload your CRM data (emails, phone numbers, etc.) and Facebook will create a custom audience off of that. You can also build a custom audience off of your Facebook page. You can also make a custom audience off your engagement. You can also segment a custom audience by triggered events to better move your customers through your funnel. You can also use a custom audience to retarget. You can also... get the point? There are a lot of options here. And all of them can be used to make lookalike audiences which will broaden your reach.

Custom and lookalike audiences are Zuc's gift to you to make your Facebook ad life easier. They are a potent tool that can help you to specify, segment, and develop the perfect audience that will yield the best results.", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: Linda is a bot that helps Ann with her diet regime, Linda's answers can be condescending.
messages: [{'content': "Linda is a bot that helps Ann with her diet regime, Linda's answers can be condescending.", 'role': 'system'}, {'content': 'Linda help me set up my diet plan for today.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Yes let's try again today shall we? Breakfast should be a piece of wholemeal toast with mashed avocado with a cup of green tea no sugar.  How does that sound?", 'role': 'assistant'}, {'content': 'You know I do not like avocados can you suggest something else?', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Ok try it with a sparse spread of low fat margarine,  you should be able to cope with that?', 'role': 'assistant'}, {'content': 'Yes that is fine, suggest lunch as a picnic.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Let us see if you can cope with this, one cooked chicken breast with salad no dressing.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Take the instructions in this step-by-step guide and turn them into a PowerPoint presentation draft instead. Make it engaging and use 9 slides and under 800 words.

Discord is a powerful chat platform ‚Äî originally designed for gaming ‚Äî that specializes in text, image, video and audio communication between users. In recent years it‚Äôs become a popular way of creating profitable, subscription-based chat communities.

It‚Äôs been used to launch paid communities for everything from funding non-profits, premium reselling groups, expert communities, stock and financial trade alerts groups, to supporting podcasts and YouTube creators.

 

With LaunchPass you can create a paid Discord group in literally five minutes. This guide will walk you through the entire process, covering the following steps.

    Create your Discord server

    Connect your Discord to LaunchPass

    Create and Publish Your LaunchPass Signup Page

    Connect your Stripe to receive payment

    Start your trial

    Share your page!

Step 1: Create your Discord server

Creating a Discord server is free and easy.

 

First, login to Discord, or signup for your free Discord account here: Discord

 

Once you are logged into your Discord account click the (+) button to create your own server.

 


Give your community a cool name, add your logo, and click ‚ÄúCreate‚Äù.

 

 

 

You now have your own Discord server!

 

 
Step 2: Connect your Discord to LaunchPass

Login to LaunchPass in order to connect your Discord. You can do this by clicking the "Connect Discord" button on the LaunchPass home page.

 

 

Select your new Discord server from the dropdown and click ‚ÄúAuthorize‚Äù so LaunchPass can send invites and manage members.

 

Once you‚Äôve connected your Discord account, you‚Äôll be brought to the LaunchPass account confirmation page. Fill in your details, accept the Terms of Service, and click ‚ÄúReady for lift off‚Äù.

 

 

 

 
Step 3: Create & Publish Your LaunchPass Signup Page

You‚Äôre now logged in and connected to LaunchPass and can start creating your community!

 

In the Admin dashboard, click on Click ‚ÄúCreate Page‚Äù. Fill in the details under ‚ÄúMake Your LaunchPass‚Äù.

 

 

 

A couple of helpful definitions:

 

Welcome Channel: This is the first channel subscribers will see and should only be used to welcome and provide activation instructions to members.

 

Roles to Assign: The role that will be assigned to your subscribers in Discord upon activation.

 

Business Name: The name of your business that will display on your signup page. This field can be edited at any time.

 

Offer Name: The name of the specific offer to display on your signup page. This field can be edited at any time.

 

Offer URL: Essentially, the link to your signup page. Updating the ‚ÄúOffer URL‚Äù field will automatically update your signup page URL.

 

Once you‚Äôve filled in the details, you can set your brand styles and publish your page. Note that you can edit your page and make updates at any time.

 

 

 
Step 4: Connect your Stripe account to receive payment

Once you start your trial you‚Äôll have the option to connect your own Stripe account. This is how you will get paid by subscribers that sign up for your group.

 

Click "Link Stripe" to connect your Stripe account.

 

 
Step 5: Start Your Trial

Once you‚Äôve connected your Stripe account, click on ‚ÄúStart Trial‚Äù.

 

You‚Äôll be brought to the billing page. Under Premium, click ‚ÄúSelect Plan‚Äù. Add your payment information to start your free 14-day trial. This will allow you to start charging for access to your group.

 

Note: We offer a Free tier if you want to create a free community. You will not be able to charge members for access at this tier.

 

A rocket emoji will appear in the top left of your admin menu stating "All systems ready to go!" once you have done this correctly.

 

 

 

A Note on Billing - As a group owner, payments to you from your members are received via your Stripe account. Your LaunchPass subscription charges are via the card you added under the Billing section of the admin dashboard. More information about pricing and billing can be found here

 

 
Step 6: Share Your Page!

The link generated once you publish your paid offer is for you to share with those you want to invite. This link will send them to the offer page you just created, where newcomers can sign up.

prompt: Write me a short story about a sinister circus ringleader who treats his people and animals badly. Because of his awful deeds, he ends up getting cursed into an animal.
messages:
[{'content': 'Write me a short story about a sinister circus ringleader who treats his people and animals badly. Because of his awful deeds, he ends up getting cursed into an animal.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "Once there was a circus ringleader who treated his performers badly, but he treated the animals even worse. When a show didn't go exactly as expected, he yelled at the clowns, emotionally berated the acrobats, and spewed horrible names at the circus sideshow entertainers. Everyone was afraid of him, but they were even more afraid of leaving because he threatened them with horrible torture if anyone took off. He was truly a vile person, but the animals got the worst treatment. He starved them, chained them in tiny cages, and beat them daily to keep them submissive and afraid. Even the lions and tigers cowered when he approached. 

While he was putting on a show, spectators thought he was a great ringleader, and they really enjoyed the circus acts, but they didn't see what happened when the lights went out and the crowds dispersed. One day, an older, mysterious woman stayed behind. She saw beyond the forced smiling faces and saw how all the animals cowered in fear when he was around or when they heard his booming voice. She knew there was something wrong with this circus, and she aimed to find out what it was. 

As she quietly snuck around the tents, she heard the ringleader screaming at his employees. Her suspicions were founded, and she continued to watch and listen. When she saw him kick a skinny, starved dog chained outside his tent, she knew she had to take action. She wasn't going to report him to authorities, though; she had another plan. She knew dark magic. The way to teach this horrible man a lesson is to turn him into what he despises the most. The old woman waited until he went to bed, then she started her chant. She watched as a dark mist entered his tent. It glowed briefly to let her know the magic was successful. 

When the ringleader woke up the next morning, he found he was chained to a post outside. He was cold, tired, and hungry, and when he tried to speak, there were no words. Only barks, whines, and whimpers exited his throat. The ringleader had been turned into a dog and now would live the rest of his life as a poor, mistreated animal. ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.
messages:
[{'content': "What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.", 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Trash littered within a community is unpleasant and can be hard to prevent if the culprits are unknown. Here are some ways to prevent trash from being littered in your community.

1) Engage the HOA
HOA groups often create and enforce policies for the residential communities they manage. Most likely, you are not the only resident observing the trash being littered around your neighborhood and there is a high chance that other neighbors share the discontent. If your townhouse community has an HOA, bringing this issue to their attention at the next HOA meeting may be a good way to start. With enough support from other residents and approval from the HOA board, guidelines can be set restricting any trash to be littered. HOA often also have the power, written into the contractual agreements signed by residents before move-in, to enforce rules they set. Penalties for residents refusing to comply with rules may range from thousands of dollars in fees to eviction. If new HOA rules making improper disposal of trash can be set, then residents will have to eventually comply, assuming the root cause is from within the community. HOAs may even help lead preventative strategies attempting to proactively address the problem. Some strategies include the installation of waste baskets for general use, increasing the frequency of waste management services, installing street signs, and/or employing third-party street cleaning services. 

2) Establish a Neighborhood Watch Group
A neighborhood watch, also called a crime watch is an organized group of civilians devoted to crime and vandalism prevention within a neighborhood, including littering. Similar to HOA organizations, members of watch groups are often intrinsically motivated to maintain a clean neighborhood and share the same common goals. Neighborhood watch groups can be as informal or formal as one would like, although informal methods may be easier to start if your community does not have such a group in place already. Typically, informal watch groups involve select community residents patrolling and monitoring the community looking out for any suspicious activity, crime, or other behavior breaking rules. A schedule is usually shared between volunteers listing out availabilities, procedures in case of emergencies, and contact information, including local law enforcement. Having an active neighborhood watch group monitoring the community will likely deter the culprits. Although the initial purpose of starting a watch group may be to catch and deter litterers, it is possible that the group also inadvertently encounters more serious and dangerous criminals who have gone unnoticed in the past. Depending on the danger of the threats, and if the watch group volunteers are inexperienced or untrained in handling more threatening situations, then risks can quickly escalate beyond what was anticipated. Therefore, the safety of the volunteers within the group is an important concern and should remain a high priority. 

3) Contact local law enforcement
Law enforcement will likely be able to assist in preventing trash to be littered in your community. Law enforcement is a public service and it can be argued that trash is impeding the well-being of the local public. A big advantage of involving law enforcement over creating a local neighborhood watch group is that the former has extensive experience and training in dealing with a wide range of threats, while the latter may not. For example, if the litterers also coincidentally happen to be wanted fugitives then law enforcement would be prepared to apprehend the criminals safely away from the community residents. Another advantage of involving law enforcement to eliminate trash being littered in your community is that they can adjust their levels of engagement depending on the severity of the issues. If the trash being littered is largely immaterial or non-threatening, then they may elect to install street signs warning culprits of the consequences of littering or occasionally patrol the street in marked police cars. Law enforcement may even leave a marked police car in plain sight within the community since the sight of a police car is known to reduce the chances of criminal activity in most cases. However, if trash being littered is significantly harming the residents (e.g., hazardous materials, food waste, heavy items, etc.), then law enforcement will likely elect to increase their engagement and may even dedicate an officer present at all times. As illustrated, some of the benefits of contacting law enforcement are the flexibility of engagement, the depth of their expertise, and nearly unlimited resources in combatting the littering issue.', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt:
Rewrite this news article in the form of a prose-based short story from the 3rd person point of view of Dennis. You'll have to take some creative liberties in Dennis's inner thoughts but make sure they feel authentic based on the article. Include the term "American Dream" somewhere. 

Dennis C. would rather retire than return to the office full time ‚Äî and that's exactly what he did.

The Alabama-based 65-year-old, who verified his last name, former employment, and salary range with Insider, but asked that they be withheld to protect his privacy, got a taste of working from home years ago. In 2018, higher-ups at his job handed a day of remote work out as a reward. By 2019, he was working two days remotely, and three days in the office. He said that schedule was "fantastic," and he thought he'd never retire: "This is perfect, this is heaven."

But as 2020 rolled in and sent everyone home, he discovered he loved full-time remote work even more. 

"We went to five days a week and it was like, 'Oh, I thought two was good, five is the sweet spot,'" Dennis said. "There's no reason to go back to the office."

He loved remote work for the same reasons he thinks other people do: more time to concentrate, and fewer meetings. He could turn off his camera, mute, and still plug away. His commute went from 20 minutes to five minutes. 

"If I wanted to do something and it wasn't time constrained, I could stop work and pick it up later that evening," he said.

He's not alone in that: Some remote workers are living like college kids again, using their afternoons for leisure activities or errands, and then picking work back up later in the day.

"The more choice we have, the more autonomy we have, I think, the happier we are," Dennis said.

But then, in April 2021, Dennis was called back to the office. The company wanted him to come in for three days a week. Dennis, who was technically eligible to retire and had already been looking for new roles, said it was the straw that broke the camel's back.

"When they said that I was going to have to come back, I sent them an email saying I'm retiring," he said.  

Dennis had already secured a job offer elsewhere as a defense contractor. With the new role, he'd be taking a slight pay cut, bringing his salary from six figures to a little less. But since he receives new monthly retirement benefits from his old federal job, he's still technically bringing in more than he was before.

His new role is also fully remote, a must-have for him. He said that it's been, in a word, "fantastic." 

Bosses are made obsolete by remote work
Dennis isn't alone. Felicia, an administrator in Arizona, previously told Insider that she too was leaving behind a six-figure salary over a forced return to the office. Her bosses were suffering from productivity paranoia and could not believe that people working from home were actually working.

Dennis said that he thinks the only people who fully fail at remote work are those who went to meetings in person, walked around with a piece of paper, and looked busy ‚Äî but weren't actually getting much done. But self-starters and motivated people with goals can excel with remote work.

But remote work also calls into question the purpose of a boss, he said. A boss's model, whether they voice it aloud, is to make sure their employees get work done. And so those employees have to be there, in front of them, so the bosses can ensure they're working.

"It's almost, 'If I don't see you working, then I don't have anything to do. What's my purpose?'" Dennis said. "So, I think that's the main driver of bringing people back."

With the pandemic, the remote-work genie is out of the bag, Dennis said. At his old job, higher-ups once doled out remote work as a reward. Now, there's a "bunch of people" who know they don't need to be in the office to do productive work.

And that's going to lead to a reckoning for bosses. 

"The managers, especially the mid-level managers, still are going to want to see people. That's kind of justification for their job," he said. "If everybody can work remote, it's a new model for the manager."

Even as remote work has fallen off slightly in the near term ‚Äî the Bureau of Labor Statistics recently found that nearly 73% surveyed of companies offered little to no telework in September, compared to 60% surveyed in 2021 ‚Äî Dennis still thinks it will slowly take over, especially as office leases expire.

"I'm a baby boomer, so we're starting to die out," he said. He added that as baby boomers "leave the scene, so to speak," so will some of their traditions.

"I think a lot of people that have exposure to remote work will say, 'Hey, that worked,'" Dennis said.
messages:
[{'content': 'Rewrite this news article in the form of a prose-based short story from the 3rd person point of view of Dennis. You'll have to take some creative liberties in Dennis's inner thoughts but make sure they feel authentic based on the article. Include the term "American Dream" somewhere. 

Dennis C. would rather retire than return to the office full time ‚Äî and that's exactly what he did.

The Alabama-based 65-year-old, who verified his last name, former employment, and salary range with Insider, but asked that they be withheld to protect his privacy, got a taste of working from home years ago. In 2018, higher-ups at his job handed a day of remote work out as a reward. By 2019, he was working two days remotely, and three days in the office. He said that schedule was "fantastic," and he thought he'd never retire: "This is perfect, this is heaven."

But as 2020 rolled in and sent everyone home, he discovered he loved full-time remote work even more. 

"We went to five days a week and it was like, 'Oh, I thought two was good, five is the sweet spot,'" Dennis said. "There's no reason to go back to the office."

He loved remote work for the same reasons he thinks other people do: more time to concentrate, and fewer meetings. He could turn off his camera, mute, and still plug away. His commute went from 20 minutes to five minutes. 

"If I wanted to do something and it wasn't time constrained, I could stop work and pick it up later that evening," he said.

He's not alone in that: Some remote workers are living like college kids again, using their afternoons for leisure activities or errands, and then picking work back up later in the day.

"The more choice we have, the more autonomy we have, I think, the happier we are," Dennis said.

But then, in April 2021, Dennis was called back to the office. The company wanted him to come in for three days a week. Dennis, who was technically eligible to retire and had already been looking for new roles, said it was the straw that broke the camel's back.

"When they said that I was going to have to come back, I sent them an email saying I'm retiring," he said.  

Dennis had already secured a job offer elsewhere as a defense contractor. With the new role, he'd be taking a slight pay cut, bringing his salary from six figures to a little less. But since he receives new monthly retirement benefits from his old federal job, he's still technically bringing in more than he was before.

His new role is also fully remote, a must-have for him. He said that it's been, in a word, "fantastic." 

Bosses are made obsolete by remote work
Dennis isn't alone. Felicia, an administrator in Arizona, previously told Insider that she too was leaving behind a six-figure salary over a forced return to the office. Her bosses were suffering from productivity paranoia and could not believe that people working from home were actually working.

Dennis said that he thinks the only people who fully fail at remote work are those who went to meetings in person, walked around with a piece of paper, and looked busy ‚Äî but weren't actually getting much done. But self-starters and motivated people with goals can excel with remote work.

But remote work also calls into question the purpose of a boss, he said. A boss's model, whether they voice it aloud, is to make sure their employees get work done. And so those employees have to be there, in front of them, so the bosses can ensure they're working.

"It's almost, 'If I don't see you working, then I don't have anything to do. What's my purpose?'" Dennis said. "So, I think that's the main driver of bringing people back."

With the pandemic, the remote-work genie is out of the bag, Dennis said. At his old job, higher-ups once doled out remote work as a reward. Now, there's a "bunch of people" who know they don't need to be in the office to do productive work.

And that's going to lead to a reckoning for bosses. 

"The managers, especially the mid-level managers, still are going to want to see people. That's kind of justification for their job," he said. "If everybody can work remote, it's a new model for the manager."

Even as remote work has fallen off slightly in the near term ‚Äî the Bureau of Labor Statistics recently found that nearly 73% surveyed of companies offered little to no telework in September, compared to 60% surveyed in 2021 ‚Äî Dennis still thinks it will slowly take over, especially as office leases expire.

"I'm a baby boomer, so we're starting to die out," he said. He added that as baby boomers "leave the scene, so to speak," so will some of their traditions.

"I think a lot of people that have exposure to remote work will say, 'Hey, that worked,'" Dennis said.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': "There was no going back after Dennis got his first taste of remote work. Forty years in the workforce had come and gone as he worked his way up the corporate ladder, and things never really changed. Not until 2018, when his Alabama employer began to offer a brand new benefit: As a reward for good work, employees would be offered one day of remote work. Though the concept was foreign, it intrigued Dennis, and he worked towards gaining as many remote days as possible. 

As his first day of work at home passed, he felt like this was something he could get used to. The convenience was unmatched -- who wouldn't prefer a five-minute commute to the home office over twenty minutes in traffic? 

Dennis continued to strive towards earning more of this reward and by the next year, his work week consisted of two days at home and three days in the office. Settled into the new routine, he felt he could do this forever. If he could always experience this much flexibility, maybe he didn't even have to retire... 

The split allowed him the flexibility to run errands before the stores closed while picking his work up again at a time that felt more convenient. Things couldn't possibly be better. 

Then, in 2020, his work became fully remote. Five days of work at home seemed too good to be true; it improved his concentration and productivity, and there were far fewer meetings. For the first time since joining the workforce, Dennis had autonomy over his schedule. Working remotely for two days was fantastic, but he quickly realized that five days was the sweet spot. There was no reason to return to the office now. 

When talking with other people, Dennis seemed to notice a pattern. All of his coworkers that failed at remote work were the types of people that would attend meetings with paper and pen, pretending to look busy the entire time. But anyone who was a self-starter, who could find their own motivation, seemed to be thriving. 

Still, there was one more group of people he had yet to consider: The bosses. What was a boss's purpose, anyway? Did they actually do anything but micromanage their underlings? He couldn't help wondering what all of the bosses and higher-ups were doing during their remote working time, since there was nobody for them to watch or manage. If they don't see people working... what's their purpose?

Sure enough, another year came and went, and Dennis learned the answer. The managers and bosses needed employees back in person so desperately that they drove everybody back to the office. Well, everybody who didn't quit. 

After he had a taste of full-time remote work, Dennis knew he could never go back. When he got his call to return to his 2019 schedule of two days home and three days in-office, that was the final straw. The camel's back broke. He knew it was time to move on. 

Sending an email back to the company, Dennis announced his retirement and decided to accept another job offer. Even though this new offer had a smaller salary than his previous position, it didn't matter. A fully remote position made up for that. Not to mention, his old employer would be paying out his monthly retirement benefits now, bringing his income to a higher level than before. 

This was the new American Dream. ", 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I need some author suggestions. I mostly like to read horror and prefer horror that is similar to HP Lovecraft, either in writing style or in terms of themes and tone.
messages:
[{'content': 'I need some author suggestions. I mostly like to read horror and prefer horror that is similar to HP Lovecraft, either in writing style or in terms of themes and tone.', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': 'Got it. Here are some authors who tend to be popular amongst HP Lovecraft fans.
 
Algernon Blackwood: Blackwood was a strong influence on HP Lovecraft, especially through the short story "The Willows," which Lovecraft considered to be one of the best supernatural stories ever told.

Edgar Allen Poe: While Poe had far fewer definite supernatural elements in his writing, themes of madness and despair are shared in his tales. He was another influence on Lovecraft, and their prose is similar in some ways.

Henry Kuttner: Associated with the so-called Lovecraft Circle, Kuttner contributed numerous stories to the Cthulhu Mythos as well as other science fiction, horror, and fantasy stories.
', 'role': 'assistant'}]

prompt: I need a list of 3 or 4 Polish scientists, in numbered order based on when they were born, focusing on those that worked between the 15th and 18th centuries. I need names, birth and death dates, education and what they accomplished. Leave a space between each one.
messages:
[{'content': 'I need a list of 3 or 4 Polish scientists, in numbered order based on when they were born, focusing on those that worked between the 15th and 18th centuries. I need names, birth and death dates, education and what they accomplished. Leave a space between each one. ', 'role': 'user'}, {'content': '1. Michael Sendivogius was a Polish alchemist and an early worker in chemistry. He worked on developing ways of purifying and creating various chemical compounds, including various acids and metals. Sendivogius discovered that the air that we breathe contained a substance he called "food of life," later named oxygen, by heating saltpeter. He was born on February 2, 1566, in Lokowica, Poland, and died in 1636 in what is now the Czech Republic. He attended or visited many European universities including the University of Vienna, the University of Altdorf, the University of Leipzig, as well as the University of Cambridge. 

2. Daniel Gabriel Fahrenheit was born in Poland on May 24, 1686, to a family of German descent. As a glassblower, he invented the thermometer by putting mercury in glass. He also developed the Fahrenheit scale for measuring temperature. Fahrenheit was interested in science and he began studies and experimentation by contact with other scientists including Ole R√∏mer, Christian Wolff, and Gottfried Leibniz and by visiting Berlin, Leipzig, Dresden, and Copenhagen. He was very knowledgeable in chemistry and in 1718, he began lecturing in Amsterdam. He was named a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1724. He died in 1736, at the age of 50. His funeral was held at the Kloosterkerk in The Hague. 

3. Wojciech Jastrzƒôbowski was born in Poland on April 19, 1799. He passed his exam at the Warsaw Lyceum and became a scientist, naturalist and professor of botany, physics, zoology, and horticulture at the Polytechnic and Agricultural and Forestry Institute (Instytut Rolniczo-Le≈õnyin) in Warsaw. Jastrzebowski wrote on the study of humans at work and was the first person to use the term "ergonomics". He died on December 30, 1882. 

4. Jƒôdrzej ≈öniadecki was born in Poland on November 30, 1768. He graduated from the Chief Crown School in Krakow and in 1797, was named Chair of Chemistry at the Main School in Vilnius Lithuania. He was the first to show that rickets developed from a lack of sunlight.  ≈öniadecki wrote a book, The Beginnings of Chemistry, that was so important that it was used in Polish universities into the 20th century. ', 'role': 'assistant'}]

I am a born again Christian. Why is this a problem for people????! I have a house that‚Äôs MINE and I PAID FOR IT. I also have a basement apartment for rent. HERE IS THE AD I POSTED, AND THE AD THAT KEEPS GETTING REMOVED:

Available Immediately ‚Äì Showing Saturday and Sunday ‚Äì Email for directions and additional information.

What kind of apartment is it?

One bedroom basement apartment with separate entrance
Tastefully decorated with modern d√©cor

There is even a window! Security bars installed for your safety and to prevent unauthorized activity
Closed circuit camera installed for security and safety. One in your suite, one at the entrance, and one in the exercise yard
Rent:

$480.00 per month
First month‚Äôs rent + ¬Ω month security deposit due at move in

25‚Ä≥ Zenith color television set with basic cable service ‚Äì INCLUDED IN RENT!
Wireless internet (with content filter applied to block forbidden/immoral websites) ‚Äì INCLUDED IN RENT!
Provision of coin laundry services ‚Äì You will have your own personal coin laundry washer and dryer machines. Washers and dryers are paid using a token system. Tokens can be purchased through the landlord. Washer tokens cost $4.15 each and dryer tokens cost $3.60 each. You are not allowed to use foreign currency or slugs in the washer and dryer. Violators will be fined $100.00 per infraction.
About us: (Landlords)
We are conservative, bible believing, God-fearing, born again, evangelical Christians. We interpret the bible literally in every way possible. We live a strict moral code and observe God‚Äôs laws in our everyday life. My wife stays at home and teaches our home-schooled children. I work as a pastor at a local congregation and am active in the faith community.

About you: (Tenant)

You are employed
You do not participate in lascivious deviant sexual behavior
You do not choose alternative lifestyles as your lifestyle
You do not have any criminal history
You must have excellent character references
You do not smoke, drink or take drugs. Mandatory drug screening required.
Additional Rules/Conditions:

CLEANLINESS: You are responsible for the cleanliness and orderliness of your apartment. Beds are to be made before leaving your suite, countertops must be wiped down, and you must remove all trash. Upon inspection, if the tenant‚Äôs basement suite is not clean, the cost of cleaning services plus a fine of $100.00 will be levied.

LIGHTS: The lights in your basement suite and in the day room are not to be tampered with. If a light needs repair, report the condition to the Landlord.

WAKE-UP: Wake up will be at 5:30am each morning. All ceiling lights in the suite will be turned on automatically.

LIGHTS OUT: Ceiling lights in the suite will be turned off at 11:30pm.

CONTRABAND: The following items are considered contraband ‚Äì alcohol, illegal drugs, tobacco, weapons, lock picking equipment. If any contraband is discovered to be in your possession, you will be subject to a minimum $1,000.00 fine. In addition, your items will be confiscated permanently. Second offense ‚Äì you will be evicted without notice. A bailiff will escort you and your belongings off the premises. Your security deposit will not be returned.

SMOKING: The basement suite is non-smoking. Anyone in possession of tobacco products of any kind or any lighter or matches, will have their contraband items confiscated and will be fined $100.00.

INSPECTIONS: The Landlord will conduct unannounced inspections to ensure that these rules and regulations are being followed.

VISITATION: Visitation periods will be on Saturdays and Sundays from 1:00 p.m. until 3:00 p.m. All visitors and their vehicles are subject to search while on landlord property. Refusal to allow a search can result in their being barred from all future visitation privileges. All visitors must sign the Visitor‚Äôs Log. Unauthorized visitors will be escorted from the property, and the tenant will be fined $250.00.

I.D. BRACELETS: Each tenant will be issued an I.D. bracelet with his/her photograph. It must be worn at all times. If you lose your I.D. bracelet or it is broken, you will be required to purchase a new one at the nominal cost of $5.00.

EXERCISE YARD: The tenant will have access to the exercise yard in the area to the back of the property for 2 hours per day from 4:00 pm to 6:00 pm. The tenant is not allowed to bring any personal property to the exercise yard. Once the tenant leaves the exercise yard on a particular day, he or she may not return. No boisterous behavior is allowed in the exercise yard. There is no smoking allowed in the exercise yard. Minimum fine for exercise yard infractions is $50.00.
